meta.dc:rights: The Government of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region

main.longTitle: An Ordinance to provide for the licensing of non-Government columbaria for keeping cremated human remains, the establishment of the Private Columbaria Licensing Board and for related matters.

section.name: s1
section.heading: Short title

subsection.content: This Ordinance may be cited as the Private Columbaria Ordinance.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Interpretation

subsection.leadIn: In this Ordinance—
subsection.def: Appeal Board (上訴委員會) means the body established under section 83(1);

approved management plan (經批准管理方案), in relation to a columbarium, means—(a)the management plan required under section 18(2) that is approved for the purpose of an application for the issue of a licence in respect of the columbarium; or(b)if such a plan is varied under section 42, the plan as varied;

approved plans (經批准圖則), in relation to a columbarium, means—(a)plans approved under section 26 (as read with section 27(3), if applicable) in respect of the columbarium that are, on the issue of a specified instrument in respect of the columbarium, annexed to the instrument; or(b)if such plans are varied under section 42, the plans as varied;

ashes (骨灰)—(a)means ashes resulting from the cremation of human remains, and (except in section 5) includes synthetic diamonds, jewellery, ornaments and any other materials transformed from human ashes; and(b)includes the container of such ashes, as well as any items interred together with such ashes in the same container (if applicable), except for the following provisions—(i)section 68(3)(d)(iv) and (v);(ii)the definitions of eligible claimant and related item in section 6(2) of Schedule 5; and(iii)sections 10, 11(4)(b)(i) and 12(4) of Schedule 5;
authorized officer (獲授權人員) means any officer appointed under section 93(3);

authorized representative (獲授權代表), in relation to an agreement for the sale of an interment right, means a person who is authorized under the agreement to claim for the return of ashes interred under the agreement (other than the person who operates, keeps, manages or in any other way has control of the columbarium in which the ashes are, or are to be, interred or an agent of such a person);

building (建築物) (except in paragraph (b) of the definition of structures certifiable for a pre-cut-off columbarium in section 4(1) of, and in section 4(2) of, Schedule 2) has the meaning given by section 2(1) of the Buildings Ordinance (Cap. 123);
building works (建築工程) has the meaning given by section 2(1) of the Buildings Ordinance (Cap. 123);

columbarium (骨灰安置所)—(a)means any premises that are used, or claimed, represented or held out to be used, for keeping ashes;(b)includes furnaces for burning offerings and any other essential ancillary facilities supporting the premises to be so used; and(c)in relation to an application for a licence, includes—(i)any premises that are indicated in the application as being intended to be used for keeping ashes; and(ii)furnaces for burning offerings and any other essential ancillary facilities that are indicated in the application as being intended to support the premises to be so used; but(d)excludes premises used or to be used for scattering ashes with the permission of the Director under section 118(1) of the Public Health and Municipal Services Ordinance (Cap. 132);
columbarium premises (骨灰安置所處所) means the premises comprising a columbarium;
cut-off time (截算時間) means 8 a.m. on 18 June 2014;

dedicated person (受供奉者) means—(a)in relation to a niche or any other area in a columbarium in which ashes of a person are interred—the person; or(b)in relation to an interment right (whether in respect of a niche or any other area in a columbarium)—a person whose ashes are to be interred by exercising the interment right, whether or not the person is living and whether or not a specific niche or area is allocated;
deed of mutual covenant (公契) has the meaning given by section 2 of the Building Management Ordinance (Cap. 344);
Director (署長) means the Director of Food and Environmental Hygiene;
enactment date (刊憲日期) means the day on which this Ordinance is published in the Gazette, that is to say, 30 June 2017; (Amended 18 of 2025 s. 3)

endorsed register (經批註登記冊), in relation to a pre-cut-off columbarium, means—(a)a register required under section 24 that is endorsed and attached to the approved plans of the columbarium, as referred to in section 26(3)(b); or(b)if such a register is varied under section 42 or updated under section 56(2)(a), the register as varied or updated;
exemption (豁免書) means an exemption issued or renewed under section 13;
in force (有效), in relation to a specified instrument—see section 16;

inter (安放), in relation to ashes of a person—(a)means keep the ashes in, on or at any premises in any manner—(i)whether or not the ashes are kept in a container; and(ii)whether or not the ashes or container of ashes are or is kept in a niche; but(b)excludes scatter ashes in, on or at any premises with the permission of the Director under section 118(1) of the Public Health and Municipal Services Ordinance (Cap. 132);
interment right (安放權), in relation to a columbarium, means the right to inter ashes in the columbarium—(a)whether or not in a specific niche or area; and(b)whether or not for a definite period;
lease (租契)—(a)means a Government lease; and(b)includes any undivided share in a Government lease;
Licensing Board (發牌委員會) means the board established under section 8;

niche (龕位) means a compartment, cubicle or vault that is used, or claimed, represented or held out to be used, for keeping ashes of one or more persons usually with the ashes of each person in a container;
non-compliant structures (違規構築物)—see section 4(1) of Schedule 2;

owner (擁有人), in relation to any premises—(a)means—(i)a person holding the premises directly from the Government, whether under a lease, short term tenancy or otherwise;(ii)a mortgagee in possession; or(iii)a person who receives the rent of the premises, solely or with another, on the person’s own behalf or that of another person, or who would receive the rent if the premises were let to a tenant; and(b)if a person referred to in paragraph (a) cannot be found or ascertained or is absent from Hong Kong or is under a disability—also means the agent of the person; but(c)excludes the Government;

premises (處所) includes a place and, in particular, includes—(a)any land or building;(b)a vehicle, vessel, aircraft, hovercraft or other conveyance, if stationary;(c)a structure (whether or not movable or offshore); and(d)a part of any of the premises described in paragraph (a), (b) or (c);

purchaser (買方), in relation to an interment right in respect of a columbarium, (except in Division 1 of Part 5 and in Schedule 4) means the person to whom the right is sold, whether or not to the person as dedicated person;
Secretary (局長) means the Secretary for Environment and Ecology; (Amended L.N. 144 of 2022)
sell (出售)—see section 3;
seller (賣方), in relation to an interment right in respect of a columbarium, (except in Division 1 of Part 5 and in Schedule 4) means the person by whom the right is sold;
specified date (指明日期) means the date on which the Private Columbaria (Amendment) Ordinance 2025 (18 of 2025) comes into operation*; (Added 18 of 2025 s. 3)
specified form (指明格式) means the form specified by the Licensing Board;
specified instrument (指明文書) means—(a)a licence;(b)an exemption; or(c)a temporary suspension of liability;
specified officer (指明人員) means the Director, an authorized officer or a public officer;
structures certifiable for a pre-cut-off columbarium (可就截算前骨灰安置所核證的構築物)—see section 4 of Schedule 2;
unleased land (未批租土地) has the meaning given by section 2 of the Land (Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 28);
validity period (有效期)—see section 15.

subsection.leadIn: In this Ordinance, a reference to an application for a specified instrument is a reference to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an application for the issue or renewal of a licence;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an application for the issue or renewal of an exemption; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an application for the issue or extension of a temporary suspension of liability.

subsection.leadIn: In this Ordinance, a reference to any of the following is to be construed in accordance with the provisions of Part 1 of Schedule 2—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: compliance with the land-related requirements;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: compliance with the planning-related requirements;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: compliance with the building-related requirements.

subsection.content: In this Ordinance, a reference to unlawful occupation of unleased land is a reference to the occupation of unleased land in contravention of section 4 of the Land (Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 28).

subsection.leadIn: In this Ordinance, a reference to occupation of land as is necessary for, or ancillary to, the operation of a columbarium is a reference to the occupation of land by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any building or building works containing niches used or intended to be used for the interment of ashes;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any area other than a niche used for the interment of ashes; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: furnaces for burning offerings and any other essential ancillary facilities supporting the building or building works referred to in paragraph (a), or the area referred to in paragraph (b), to be used as referred to in that paragraph.

subsection.continued: Unlawful occupation of unleased land as is necessary for, or ancillary to, the operation of a columbarium is to be construed accordingly.

subsection.leadIn: In this Ordinance, a reference to unauthorized development undertaken or continued as is necessary for, or ancillary to, the operation of a columbarium is a reference to the unauthorized development in the form of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any building or building works containing niches used or intended to be used for the interment of ashes; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: furnaces for burning offerings and any other essential ancillary facilities supporting the building or building works referred to in paragraph (a) to be used as referred to in that paragraph.

subsection.leadIn: In this Ordinance, a reference to structures necessary for, or ancillary to, the operation of a columbarium is a reference to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: building or building works—

subparagraph.content: that contain niches used or intended to be used for the interment of ashes; or
that are otherwise used for the interment of ashes; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: building or building works that are furnaces for burning offerings and any other essential ancillary facilities supporting the building or building works referred to in paragraph (a) to be used as referred to in that paragraph.

subsection.content: In this Ordinance, a reference to non-compliant structures necessary for, or ancillary to, the operation of a columbarium is a reference to non-compliant structures that are structures necessary for, or ancillary to, the operation of the columbarium within the meaning of subsection (7).

If a specified instrument is transferred under section 39, a reference in this Ordinance to the person holding the instrument is to be construed as a reference to the person to whom it has been transferred.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Meaning of sale of interment right

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Ordinance—
subsection.def: sell (出售), in relation to an interment right, includes—(a)offer the interment right for sale; and(b)make an agreement for the sale of the interment right to another person.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Ordinance, a sale of an interment right in respect of a columbarium includes a disposition of the interment right to a person if the person, directly or indirectly, in connection with the disposition makes payments (whether or not any of the payments are described as donations) in one or more of the following manners—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: pays a sum periodically during the period for which the interment right lasts;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: pays a fixed sum, by instalment or otherwise;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: makes payments in any other manner.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Ordinance—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a sale of an interment right in respect of a columbarium includes—

subparagraph.content: such a sale, even before the columbarium is constructed;
such a sale, even if no dedicated person is named; and
such a sale to a person for resale; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a sale of an interment right in respect of a niche in a columbarium includes a sale of an interment right in respect of—

subparagraph.content: a particular niche, or a niche to be allocated, in the columbarium; or
a niche in existence, or a niche to be constructed, in the columbarium.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Ordinance not applicable to Government columbaria, private cemeteries, private crematoria, undertakers of burials, etc.

subsection.leadIn: This Ordinance does not apply to any of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a columbarium that is built, operated, administered or maintained by the Government, including one that is in a Government crematorium specified in Part 5 of the Fifth Schedule to the Public Health and Municipal Services Ordinance (Cap. 132);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a columbarium that is in a private cemetery specified in Part 2 of that Schedule;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a columbarium under the management and control of a person specified in Part 2A of that Schedule;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: an authorized private crematorium specified in Part 6 of that Schedule to the extent that the keeping of ashes in it is transient and incidental to its operation as a crematorium.

subsection.leadIn: This Ordinance (except Part 7 and Schedule 5) does not apply to a columbarium if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it is in premises specified, in a licence referred to in the Undertakers of Burials Regulation (Cap. 132 sub. leg. CB), as the licence holder’s place of business; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the licence does not prohibit the keeping of ashes in that place of business.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Ordinance not applicable to premises where ash transforming work is carried out

subsection.leadIn: This Ordinance does not apply to any premises that are used for carrying out the transformation work in respect of any ashes (workplace) if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the workplace is not situated within any columbarium premises;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the keeping of ashes in the workplace is transient and incidental to the carrying out of the transformation work;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: no interment right in respect of the workplace is sold;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: no person may be allowed to pay worship, and no ritual offerings may be given, in the workplace to any deceased person; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: the person operating, keeping, managing or in any other way having control of the workplace—

subparagraph.content: has kept a register of the delivery of ashes and synthetic materials to and from the workplace;

subparagraph.leadIn: has entered the following particulars into the register—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the name of each deceased person whose ashes are delivered to the workplace, and the date of the delivery of those ashes to the workplace; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: the description of the synthetic material that the ashes of each deceased person are transformed into, and the date of the delivery of the synthetic material and the remaining ashes (if any) from the workplace; and
makes the register available for inspection, on request, by the Director or an authorized officer.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: synthetic material (人造物料), in relation to any ashes, means the synthetic diamond, jewellery, ornament or other material transformed from the ashes or part of the ashes;

transformation work (轉化工序), in relation to any ashes—(a)means the manufacturing process by which the ashes, or part of the ashes, are transformed into synthetic material; and(b)includes any activity that is ancillary to any such manufacturing process (such as the delivery and collection of the ashes or the synthetic material).

subsection.leadIn: In this section, a reference to giving ritual offerings includes a reference to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the laying of flowers or wreaths; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the burning of candle-sticks, joss paper, incense or sacrificial articles.

section.name: s5A
section.heading: Ordinance not applicable to eligible masons’ workshops in relation to individual sets of ashes

subsection.leadIn: This Ordinance does not apply to an eligible masons’ workshop in relation to a set of ashes of a deceased person kept in the workshop if—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: no person may be allowed to pay worship, and no ritual offerings may be given, in the workshop to the deceased person;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: the operator of the workshop—

subparagraph.leadIn: makes the following available for inspection, on request, by the Director or an authorized officer—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the register;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: copies of the relevant documents kept by the operator for the purposes of subparagraph (ii); and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: no interment right in respect of the workshop is sold.

subsection.leadIn: In subsection (1)(b), a reference to giving ritual offerings includes—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: laying flowers or wreaths; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: burning candle-sticks, joss paper, incense or sacrificial articles.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (1)(c)(i), the matters in relation to the delivery of the ashes to, and the removal of the ashes from, the eligible masons’ workshop are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: details of the delivery and the removal;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the identity of the deceased person;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: descriptions of the relevant documents of the deceased person; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: the name and contact details of—

subparagraph.content: the person who engages the workshop to provide masonry work in relation to the ashes; and
the person who collects the ashes from the workshop (if available).

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: approved plan (核准圖) means a plan within the meaning of section 1A(2)(b) of Cap. 131;
Cap. 131 (《第131章》) means the Town Planning Ordinance (Cap. 131);
draft plan (草圖) means a draft plan prepared under section 3(1)(a) of Cap. 131;

eligible masons’ workshop (合資格石廠) means any premises—(a)where a business primarily providing services in masonry work is operated; and(b)that are not located in a zone or district designated as “Residential (Group A)” on a draft plan, partly approved plan or approved plan exhibited under Cap. 131;

masonry work (石工作業), in relation to a set of ashes, means the process that consists of—(a)collecting or returning the ashes;(b)filling the ashes into a container; and(c)any of the following—(i)interring, burying or scattering the ashes at a columbarium specified in section 4(1)(a);(ii)interring, burying or scattering the ashes at a cemetery or garden of remembrance specified in Parts 1, 2, 4A and 7 of the Fifth Schedule to Cap. 132;(iii)interring, burying or scattering the ashes at a columbarium managed and controlled by a person specified in Part 2A of the Fifth Schedule to Cap. 132;(iv)interring, burying or scattering the ashes with the permission under section 118(1) of Cap. 132 at a place other than a cemetery;
partly approved plan (局部核准圖) means a plan within the meaning of section 1A(2)(a) of Cap. 131;

section.name: s6
section.heading: Ordinance not applicable to premises where transient exhibition of ashes is held
section.leadIn: This Ordinance does not apply to any premises during the time when an exhibition of ashes is held in, on or at them if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the exhibition is held for a period of not more than 14 days;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: ashes are kept in, on or at the premises only for the purpose of the exhibition;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: no more than 10 containers of ashes are kept in, on or at the premises;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: each container contains, or is claimed, represented or held out to be containing, the ashes of only 1 person; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: no interment right in respect of the premises is sold.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Ordinance not applicable to domestic keeping of ashes

subsection.leadIn: This Ordinance does not apply to the keeping of ashes in any domestic premises if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: no more than 10 containers of ashes are kept in the premises; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: each container contains, or is claimed, represented or held out to be containing, the ashes of only 1 person.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: domestic premises (住宅) means premises used solely or principally for residential purposes and constituting a separate household unit.

section.name: s8
section.heading: Establishment of Licensing Board

subsection.content: A board is established with the name “Private Columbaria Licensing Board” in English and “私營骨灰安置所發牌委員會” in Chinese.
Schedule 1 (which makes provisions about the constitution, administration and proceedings of the Licensing Board) has effect.

section.name: s9
section.heading: Functions and powers of Licensing Board

subsection.leadIn: The functions of the Licensing Board are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: to regulate the operation and management of columbaria and, in particular—

subparagraph.content: to consider and determine applications made to it under this Ordinance;
to issue guidelines and codes of practice about the operation and management of columbaria; and

to handle complaints against, and investigate into irregularities of, operators of columbaria and to exercise the power to revoke or suspend a specified instrument or other disciplinary powers under this Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to do any other things that the Licensing Board is required or authorized to do by this Ordinance.

subsection.content: The Licensing Board has all ancillary powers that may be necessary to enable it to perform its functions.

section.name: s10
section.heading: Restriction on operating columbarium

subsection.content: A person must not operate, keep, manage or in any other way have control of a columbarium, otherwise than under a licence.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) does not prohibit a person from operating, keeping, managing or in any other way having control of a columbarium, otherwise than under a licence, if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person does not sell any interment right in respect of the columbarium; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the person holds, in respect of the columbarium—

subparagraph.content: an exemption; or
a temporary suspension of liability.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a specified instrument in respect of a columbarium; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an authorization under a licence to sell interment rights in respect of a columbarium,

subsection.continued: is suspended, a person who operates, keeps, manages or in any other way has control of the columbarium under the specified instrument or licence does not contravene subsection (1) in respect of the columbarium if all the requirements, terms and conditions imposed by the Licensing Board upon suspending the specified instrument or authorization are complied with.

subsection.content: A person does not contravene subsection (1) in respect of a columbarium merely by giving an undertaking to carry out the prescribed ash disposal procedures (within the meaning of section 7 of Schedule 5) in respect of the columbarium and actually carrying out the procedures.

section.name: s11
section.heading: Offences relating to section 10

subsection.leadIn: If a person contravenes section 10(1) in respect of a columbarium—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person commits an offence; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: each person who is the owner, tenant, lessee or person in charge of the columbarium premises commits an offence.

subsection.leadIn: A person who commits an offence under subsection (1) is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine of $2,000,000 and to imprisonment for 3 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $5,000,000 and to imprisonment for 7 years.

subsection.leadIn: A person charged with an offence under subsection (1) in respect of any premises has a defence if the person establishes that, at the time of the alleged offence—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person did not know and could not have reasonably known that the premises concerned were a columbarium; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the person believed on reasonable grounds that the person who operated, kept, managed or otherwise had control of the columbarium—

subparagraph.content: did so under a licence; or
did not sell any interment right in respect of the columbarium and held, in respect of the columbarium, an exemption or temporary suspension of liability.

subsection.leadIn: A person charged with an offence under subsection (1) is to be taken to have established a fact that needs to be established for the purpose of a defence under subsection (3)(a) or (b) if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: there is sufficient evidence to raise an issue as to that alleged fact; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the contrary is not proved by the prosecution beyond reasonable doubt.

subsection.content: Subsection (1) has effect subject to section 75(1).

section.name: s12
section.heading: Interpretation of Part 4
section.leadIn: In this Part—
section.def: ash interment capacity (骨灰安放容量), in relation to a columbarium in respect of which a licence is applied for or is issued, means the following particulars—(a)the maximum number of containers of ashes that may be interred in each niche in the columbarium, and the total maximum number of sets of ashes that may be interred in the niches;(b)the total maximum number of sets of ashes that may be interred otherwise than in niches in any area in the columbarium; and(c)the total maximum number of sets of ashes that may be interred in the columbarium;

ash interment layout (骨灰安放布局), in relation to a columbarium, means the following particulars—(a)the location and serial numbering of niches in the columbarium;(b)any area in the columbarium in which ashes may be interred otherwise than in niches; and(c)if an exemption is applied for or is issued in respect of the columbarium that is a columbarium of a Chinese temple as referred to in section 57—the location of the religious ash pagoda (as defined by section 57(14));

ash interment quantity (骨灰安放數量), in relation to a columbarium, means the following particulars—(a)the number of containers of ashes interred in each niche in the columbarium and the total number of sets of ashes interred in the niches;(b)the number of sets of ashes that are interred otherwise than in niches in any area in the columbarium; and(c)the total number of sets of ashes that are interred in the columbarium.

section.name: s13
section.heading: Licence, exemption and temporary suspension of liability
section.leadIn: The Licensing Board may, on application and subject to any conditions that the Licensing Board thinks fit to impose in addition to the conditions mentioned in section 30, 33 or 36 (as the case requires)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: issue or renew a licence in respect of a columbarium;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: issue or renew an exemption in respect of a pre-cut-off columbarium; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: issue or extend a temporary suspension of liability in respect of a pre-cut-off columbarium.

section.name: s14
section.heading: Time limit for application for specified instrument

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), an application for the issue of a licence in respect of a columbarium may be made to the Licensing Board at any time after the expiry of 6 months beginning on the enactment date.

subsection.leadIn: An application for the issue of a specified instrument in respect of a pre-cut-off columbarium must be made to the Licensing Board at any time—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: after the expiry of 6 months beginning on the enactment date; but

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: before the expiry of 9 months beginning on that date.

subsection.content: An application for the renewal of a licence or exemption must be made to the Licensing Board not later than 18 months before the expiry of the validity period of the licence or exemption (as the case requires).

Subject to subsection (5), an application for the extension of a temporary suspension of liability must be made to the Licensing Board not later than 12 months before the expiry of the validity period of the temporary suspension of liability.

If the validity period of a temporary suspension of liability does not exceed 12 months, an application for the extension of the temporary suspension of liability must be made to the Licensing Board not later than the date specified by it.

subsection.leadIn: Despite subsections (2), (3), (4) and (5), the Licensing Board may consider an application for a specified instrument out of time if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the applicant has a reasonable excuse for failing to make the application within time; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in all the circumstances of the case, the Licensing Board considers that it is just and equitable to consider the application.

section.name: s14A
section.heading: Supplementary provisions to section 14: application for exemption

subsection.leadIn: Despite section 14(2), an application for the issue of an exemption in respect of a pre-cut-off columbarium may also be made—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: after the specified date; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: within a period to be specified by the Licensing Board.

subsection.leadIn: The Licensing Board may consider an application under subsection (1) out of time if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the applicant has a reasonable excuse for failing to make the application within time; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in all the circumstances of the case, the Licensing Board considers that it is just and equitable to consider the application.

section.name: s15
section.heading: Validity period of specified instrument

subsection.content: The Licensing Board may, in its discretion, determine the term for which the specified instrument is issued, renewed or extended (validity period).

subsection.leadIn: The validity period of a licence must not exceed the shorter of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: where—

subparagraph.content: the columbarium premises are held directly from the Government under a lease—the remainder of the term of the lease; or
the columbarium premises are occupied under a tenancy—the remainder of the term of the tenancy;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: 10 years.

subsection.leadIn: The validity period of an exemption must not exceed—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: where the columbarium premises are held directly from the Government under a lease—the remainder of the term of the lease; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where the columbarium premises are occupied under a tenancy—the remainder of the term of the tenancy.

subsection.content: The validity period of a temporary suspension of liability must not exceed 3 years.

Subject to subsections (2)(b) and (4), where the columbarium premises are occupied under a short term tenancy granted by the Government, the validity period of a specified instrument issued, renewed or extended in respect of the premises may be concurrent with the period for which the short term tenancy lasts.
A licence may be subject to review within its validity period on the dates specified in the licence.
A temporary suspension of liability may not be extended more than once, unless exceptional circumstances exist.

section.name: s16
section.heading: Specified instrument in force despite certain events

subsection.content: A specified instrument remains in force despite a suspension under section 40 if all the requirements, terms and conditions imposed by the Licensing Board upon suspending the instrument (suspension requirements) are complied with.
For the purposes of sections 47, 59 and 70, a specified instrument is also regarded as in force despite a suspension under section 40 even if the suspension requirements are not complied with.

subsection.leadIn: A specified instrument remains in force despite the expiry of its validity period if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the following application was made before the expiry—

subparagraph.content: an application under section 14 for the renewal or extension of the instrument; or
an application under section 39 for the transfer of the instrument; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the instrument expires before the Licensing Board determines the application.

subsection.leadIn: However, the specified instrument remains in force only until the earlier of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the determination of the application;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the occurrence of any of the following events—

subparagraph.content: the withdrawal of the application;
the revocation of the instrument under section 40;
if the instrument is a licence—the expiry of the term referred to in section 15(2)(a)(i) or (ii);
if the instrument is an exemption—the expiry of the term referred to in section 15(3)(a) or (b).

subsection.content: A specified instrument remains in force despite the death or dissolution of its holder.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: specified instrument (指明文書), in relation to a specified instrument that is a licence, does not include any authorization under the licence to sell interment rights.

section.name: s17
section.heading: No specified instrument issued if columbarium subject to specified law enforcement action

subsection.content: Subsections (2) and (3) have effect despite section 13.

subsection.leadIn: The Licensing Board may not grant an application for the issue of a specified instrument in respect of a columbarium if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the operation of the columbarium, or any part of it, constitutes an unauthorized development in contravention of section 20(7), 21(1) or 21F(1) of the Town Planning Ordinance (Cap. 131); and (Amended 25 of 2023 s. 127)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in respect of the unauthorized development—

subparagraph.content: proceedings for prosecution of an offence under section 20(8), 21(2) or 21F(2) of that Ordinance have been instituted, whether against the applicant or any other person, before the making of the application; or (Amended 25 of 2023 s. 127)

subparagraph.leadIn: a notice—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: has been served, whether on the applicant or any other person, under section 23(1) or (2) of that Ordinance before the making of the application; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: has not been complied with or withdrawn.

subsection.leadIn: The Licensing Board may not grant an application for the issue of a specified instrument in respect of a columbarium if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any building or building works in, on or at the columbarium, or any part of it, have been completed or carried out in contravention of section 14(1) of the Buildings Ordinance (Cap. 123); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in respect of the building or building works, an order under section 24(1) of that Ordinance—

subparagraph.content: has been served, whether on the applicant or any other person, before the making of the application; and
has not been complied with or withdrawn.

subdivision.name: SD1
subdivision.heading: Licence for Operating Columbaria (Including Selling Interment Rights)

section.name: s18
section.heading: Licence—eligibility based on legal compliance, premises held from Government, etc.

subsection.leadIn: The Licensing Board may refuse an application for the issue of a licence in respect of a columbarium if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the applicant fails to prove to the satisfaction of the Licensing Board that the columbarium complies with all of the following—

subparagraph.content: the land-related requirements;
the planning-related requirements;
the building-related requirements; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the applicant fails to prove to the satisfaction of the Licensing Board that the applicant holds the columbarium premises directly from the Government under a lease.

subsection.content: Despite section 13, the Licensing Board may grant an application for the issue of a licence in respect of a columbarium only if a management plan, submitted by the applicant in respect of the columbarium and covering matters required under section 97, has been approved by the Licensing Board.

In relation to an application for the issue of a licence in respect of a columbarium, where a deed of mutual covenant is in force in respect of the columbarium premises, the Licensing Board may refuse the application if the applicant fails to produce the legal advice required under section 23(3).

section.name: s19
section.heading: Modifications of section 18 for pre-cut-off columbarium

subsection.leadIn: In relation to an application for the issue of a licence in respect of a pre-cut-off columbarium, section 18 is modified in the manner specified in subsections (2) and (3) if the applicant proves to the satisfaction of the Licensing Board—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the ash interment layout is limited in extent to that as at the cut-off time;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that the ash interment capacity is limited to that as at the cut-off time; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: that the extent of occupation of land as is necessary for, or ancillary to, the operation of the columbarium is limited to that as was necessary for, or ancillary to, its operation as at the cut-off time.

subsection.leadIn: The Licensing Board may decide not to refuse the application only because the applicant fails to prove the matter mentioned in section 18(1)(a)(iii) if the applicant proves to the satisfaction of the Licensing Board that—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the requirements applicable to the structures (specified in section 4(3) of Schedule 2) are complied with.

subsection.leadIn: The Licensing Board may decide not to refuse the application only because the applicant fails to prove the matter mentioned in section 18(1)(b) if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Licensing Board is of the opinion that it would have granted the application but for that section; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the applicant proves to the satisfaction of the Licensing Board that the applicant has the right to continue to use the columbarium premises for at least 5 years beginning on the date on which the licence, if issued, is to take effect.

subdivision.name: SD2
subdivision.heading: Instruments for Pre-cut-off Columbaria to Continue Operation, without Selling Interment Rights

section.name: s20
section.heading: Exemption for pre-cut-off columbarium—eligibility based on datedness, legal compliance and premises held from Government or right to occupation

subsection.leadIn: The Licensing Board may refuse an application for the issue of an exemption in respect of a pre-cut-off columbarium if the applicant fails to prove to the satisfaction of the Licensing Board one or more of the following matters—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the ash interment layout is limited in extent to that as at the cut-off time;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that the ash interment quantity is limited to that as at the cut-off time;

paragraph.name: c
d
paragraph.content: that the columbarium commenced operation before 1 January 1990;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: that no interment right in respect of the columbarium has been sold since the cut-off time;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the columbarium complies with the land-related requirements;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.leadIn: either—

subparagraph.content: the columbarium complies with the building-related requirements; or

the non-compliant structures necessary for, or ancillary to, the operation of the columbarium are structures certifiable for a pre-cut-off columbarium, and the requirements applicable to the structures (specified in section 4(3) of Schedule 2) are complied with;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.leadIn: either—

subparagraph.content: the applicant holds the columbarium premises directly from the Government under a lease; or

if the Licensing Board is of the opinion that it would have granted the application but for subparagraph (i)—the applicant has the right to continue to use the columbarium premises for at least 5 years beginning on the date on which the exemption, if issued, is to take effect.

subsection.leadIn: The Licensing Board may decide not to refuse the application only because the applicant fails to prove the matter mentioned in subsection (1)(b) if the applicant proves to the satisfaction of the Licensing Board that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the increase in the ash interment quantity since the cut-off time is caused only by sets of ashes interred in the columbarium before the enactment date (new sets of ashes); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: each new set of ashes is either—

subparagraph.content: ashes interred or to be interred in a niche, where the interment right in respect of the niche was sold before the cut-off time; or
ashes interred in a religious ash pagoda (as defined by section 57(14)), where no fees, charges or other sums were paid, or are payable, for the interment of ashes.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (1)(d), the operation of a columbarium commenced on the earlier of the following times—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the earliest time when a set of ashes was interred in any niche in the columbarium;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the earliest time when an interment right in respect of any niche in the columbarium was sold.

section.name: s20A
section.heading: Supplementary provisions to section 20: application for exemption under section 14A

subsection.leadIn: The Licensing Board may refuse an application made under section 14A if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the applicant fails to prove to the satisfaction of the Licensing Board one or more of the matters mentioned in section 20(1)(a), (b), (c), (d), (e), (f), (g) and (h) on the basis that, subject to subsection (3), those matters apply to such an application as they apply to an application made under section 20; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the applicant fails to prove to the satisfaction of the Licensing Board, as at the specified date—

subparagraph.leadIn: that an application for the issue of a licence in respect of the pre-cut-off columbarium (licence application) has been made by the applicant, and that—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the licence application has not been determined, granted or refused by the Licensing Board; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: the licence application has not been withdrawn;
that the columbarium is not located in a zone or district designated as “Residential (Group A)” on a draft plan, partly approved plan or approved plan exhibited under Cap. 131; and
that either Condition 1 or Condition 2 specified in subsection (2) is satisfied.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (1)(b)(iii)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: Condition 1 is that a planning application in respect of the pre-cut-off columbarium has been accepted or granted by the Town Planning Board, regardless of whether or not there had been any other planning application in respect of the columbarium that had been refused;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: Condition 2 is that no planning application in respect of the columbarium has been refused by the Town Planning Board.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (1)(a)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: section 20(1)(d) applies in relation to the application as if the words “the cut-off time” were substituted for the words “1 January 1990” in that section; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: sections 20(1)(b) and (e), 23(1)(b)(ii), 24(1)(a) and (b) and 27(1)(c)(i) apply in relation to the application as if the words “beginning of the enactment date” were substituted for the words “cut-off time” in those sections.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (2)(a) and (b)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a reference to a planning application being accepted is a reference to an application under section 12A(1) of Cap. 131 being accepted, in whole or in part, under section 12A(23)(a) of Cap. 131;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a reference to a planning application being granted is a reference to the permission applied for in an application under section 16(1) of Cap. 131 being granted under section 16(3) of Cap. 131; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: a reference to a planning application being refused—

subparagraph.content: if the planning application is an application under section 12A(1) of Cap. 131—is a reference to the application being refused under section 12A(23)(b) of Cap. 131; or
if the planning application is an application under section 16(1) of Cap. 131—is a reference to the refusal to grant the permission applied for in the application under section 16(3) of Cap. 131.

subsection.content: If the Licensing Board grants an application made under section 14A, sections 38, 54(2), 55(a) and 104(2)(d) apply in relation to the exemption as if the words “beginning of the enactment date” were substituted for the words “cut-off time” in those sections.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: approved plan (核准圖) means a plan within the meaning of section 1A(2)(b) of Cap. 131;
Cap. 131 (《第131章》) means the Town Planning Ordinance (Cap. 131);
draft plan (草圖) means a draft plan prepared under section 3(1)(a) of Cap. 131;
partly approved plan (局部核准圖) means a plan within the meaning of section 1A(2)(a) of Cap. 131;

planning application (規劃申請), in relation to a pre-cut-off columbarium, means—(a)an application under section 12A(1) of Cap. 131 in respect of the columbarium; or(b)an application under section 16(1) of Cap. 131 in respect of the columbarium.

section.name: s21
section.heading: Temporary suspension of liability for pre-cut-off columbarium—eligibility based on accompanying application for licence or exemption, etc.

subsection.leadIn: The Licensing Board may refuse an application for the issue of a temporary suspension of liability in respect of a pre-cut-off columbarium unless the applicant has also made in respect of the columbarium either or both of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an application for the issue of a licence;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an application for the issue of an exemption.

subsection.leadIn: The Licensing Board may refuse an application for the issue of a temporary suspension of liability in respect of a pre-cut-off columbarium if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the applicant fails to prove to the satisfaction of the Licensing Board one or more of the following matters—

subparagraph.content: that the ash interment layout is limited in extent to that as at the cut-off time;

if the applicant also applies for the issue of a licence in respect of the columbarium—that the ash interment capacity is limited to that as at the cut-off time and the ash interment quantity is limited to that as at the beginning of the enactment date;

that the extent of occupation of land as is necessary for, or ancillary to, the operation of the columbarium is limited to that as was necessary for, or ancillary to, its operation as at the cut-off time; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the occupation of land as is necessary for, or ancillary to, the operation of the columbarium (to the extent as shown in the plans required under section 25) includes unlawful occupation of unleased land but the applicant—

subparagraph.content: does not apply to the Director of Lands for lawful authority to occupy the unleased land; or

does not provide a written declaration to the Director of Lands that the applicant has no claim to the unleased land, whether based on possession of the unleased land before, on or after the date of application or on any other ground.

subsection.content: The Licensing Board may refuse an application under subsection (1) if the applicant fails to prove to the satisfaction of the Licensing Board that the columbarium has been certified, by a qualified professional, as not posing any obvious or imminent danger in terms of building safety and fire safety.

subsection.leadIn: The Licensing Board may decide not to refuse the application (made together with a related application for the issue of an exemption) only because the applicant fails to prove the matter mentioned in subsection (2)(a)(iii) if the applicant proves to the satisfaction of the Licensing Board that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the increase in the ash interment quantity since the cut-off time is caused only by sets of ashes interred in the columbarium before the enactment date (new sets of ashes); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: each new set of ashes is either—

subparagraph.content: ashes interred or to be interred in a niche, where the interment right in respect of the niche was sold before the cut-off time; or
ashes interred in a religious ash pagoda (as defined by section 57(14)), where no fees, charges or other sums were paid, or are payable, for the interment of ashes.

section.name: s22
section.heading: Considerations relevant to determination of applications

subsection.content: Subsection (2) applies to the determination by the Licensing Board of an application for a specified instrument in respect of a columbarium.

subsection.leadIn: The Licensing Board—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must have regard to the public interest; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may have regard to any other relevant considerations.

subsection.leadIn: In relation to an application for the issue of a licence or exemption or an application for the extension of a temporary suspension of liability, the other relevant considerations referred to in subsection (2)(b) include (but are not limited to)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: whether the applicant has or has not complied with, in respect of the columbarium, the applicable requirements in Schedule 2; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the record of the steps that the applicant has taken in respect of the columbarium towards meeting those requirements.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (3), a reference to the applicant in that subsection is to be construed as including a reference to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the applicant is a partner in a partnership—any other partner in the partnership; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the applicant is a body corporate—a director or other officer concerned in the management of the body corporate.

section.name: s23
section.heading: Form of, and information required for, application

subsection.leadIn: An application for a specified instrument in respect of a columbarium—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be made, in writing, to the Licensing Board in the specified form and in the manner determined by it; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: must be accompanied by—

subparagraph.content: for an application for the issue of an exemption in respect of a pre-cut-off columbarium (if any interment right in respect of any niche in the columbarium was sold before the cut-off time, but has not been exercised or has only been exercised partially)—the registers required under section 24;
the plans of the columbarium; and

subparagraph.leadIn: the information, certificates and other documents—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: specified in the application form; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: otherwise reasonably required by the Licensing Board.

subsection.content: Without limiting subsection (1)(b)(iv), the Licensing Board may, in relation to an application for a specified instrument in respect of a columbarium, require the applicant to produce evidence to prove to the satisfaction of the Licensing Board that the owner of the columbarium premises has, or all the joint owners or co-owners of the columbarium premises have, given authorization or consent for the premises to be used as a columbarium.

subsection.leadIn: In addition to the information required under subsection (1)(b), an application for the issue of a licence in respect of a columbarium, where a deed of mutual covenant is in force in respect of the columbarium premises, must be accompanied by a written legal advice of a legal practitioner (who is qualified to practise as counsel or to act as a solicitor in Hong Kong) confirming that there is no express restrictive covenant in the deed to the effect that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any use of the premises as a columbarium is prohibited;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any commercial use of the premises is prohibited; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: only private residential use of the premises is permitted.

section.name: s24
section.heading: Requirements about registers accompanying application

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of section 23(1)(b)(ii), the following registers of a pre-cut-off columbarium are to accompany an application for the issue of an exemption in respect of the columbarium—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: a register on the niches in the columbarium in respect of which the interment rights were sold before the cut-off time but have only been exercised partially.

subsection.leadIn: The registers—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be in the specified form;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must contain the particulars specified by the Licensing Board; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: must be kept in the manner determined by the Licensing Board.

section.name: s25
section.heading: Requirements about plans accompanying application

subsection.content: For the purposes of section 23(1)(b)(iii), the plans of a columbarium that are to accompany an application for a specified instrument in respect of a columbarium must comply with the requirements in this section.
The plans must include a site plan, layout plan and floor plans, each of which must be in the number of copies, and drawn to the scale, that the Licensing Board requires.

subsection.leadIn: The plans must show the following particulars to be authorized or permitted by the specified instrument under application—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the ash interment layout;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for an application for the issue or renewal of a licence—the ash interment capacity;

paragraph.name: c
d
paragraph.content: the extent of occupation of land as is necessary for, or ancillary to, the operation of the columbarium;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the structures necessary for, or ancillary to, the operation of the columbarium.

subsection.leadIn: A qualified professional must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: certify that the current site situation of the columbarium premises conforms to the plans in all respects; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the current site situation of the columbarium premises does not conform to the plans in all respects—identify the difference, with annotations, on the plans.

section.name: s26
section.heading: Approved plans to be endorsed

subsection.leadIn: The Licensing Board may approve plans of a columbarium for the purposes of an application for a specified instrument only if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: it is satisfied that either—

subparagraph.content: if not, the difference identified on the plans (as required under section 25(4)(b)) is not contradictory to the particulars to be authorized or permitted as mentioned in paragraph (b); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: having regard to sections 17, 18, 19, 20, 20A, 21 and 22, the Licensing Board decides to grant the application and authorize or permit the particulars specified in subsection (2) as shown in the plans. (Amended 18 of 2025 s. 7)

subsection.leadIn: The particulars are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the ash interment layout;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for an application for the issue or renewal of a licence—the ash interment capacity;

paragraph.name: c
d
paragraph.content: the extent of occupation of land as is necessary for, or ancillary to, the operation of the columbarium; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the structures necessary for, or ancillary to, the operation of the columbarium.

subsection.leadIn: On approving the plans, the Licensing Board—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must endorse the approval on each plan in each set of the plans to that effect;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: must return 1 set of the plans to the applicant; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: may retain the remaining sets of plans.

subdivision.name: SD2
subdivision.heading: Applications in respect of Pre-cut-off Columbaria

section.name: s27
section.heading: Application concerning pre-cut-off columbarium—evidence of ash interment layout and quantity, etc. and plans

subsection.leadIn: An application for a specified instrument in respect of a pre-cut-off columbarium, to which an eligibility-related provision is relevant, must be accompanied by evidence of the following particulars (each is called an eligibility-related particular)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the ash interment layout as at the cut-off time;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for an application for the issue or renewal of a licence—the ash interment capacity as at the cut-off time;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: for an application for the issue or renewal of an exemption, or for the issue or extension of a temporary suspension of liability—

subparagraph.content: the ash interment quantity as at the cut-off time; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the extent of occupation of land as was necessary for, or ancillary to, the operation of the columbarium as at the cut-off time;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the fact that any structures necessary for, or ancillary to, the operation of the columbarium existed as at the cut-off time; and

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: for an application for the issue of an exemption—the earliest date on which a set of ashes was interred in any niche in the columbarium or the earliest date on which an interment right in respect of any niche in the columbarium was sold.

subsection.leadIn: In addition to showing the particulars required under section 25(3), the plans accompanying an application for a specified instrument in respect of a pre-cut-off columbarium must also meet the following requirements—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: they must show the eligibility-related particulars; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: they must identify the extent (if any) to which the particulars to be authorized or permitted as referred to in section 25(3) differ from those as referred to in paragraph (a).

subsection.leadIn: On approving the plans in accordance with section 26 for the purposes of an application for a specified instrument in respect of a pre-cut-off columbarium, the Licensing Board must decide on, and identify, the following in the plans—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: for an exemption in respect of the columbarium that is a columbarium of a Chinese temple as referred to in section 57—the location of the religious ash pagoda (as defined by section 57(14)); and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: structures certifiable for a pre-cut-off columbarium in, on or at the columbarium as are covered by the specified instrument.

subsection.leadIn: In subsection (1)—
subsection.def: eligibility-related provision (資格相關條文) means section 19, 20, 20A or 21 or section 4 of Schedule 2. (Amended 18 of 2025 s. 8)

section.name: s28
section.heading: Notification scheme: proof of particulars about pre-cut-off columbarium

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: eligibility-related provision (資格相關條文) has the meaning given by section 27(4);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: notifiable particulars (須通報詳情) means batch 1 particulars or batch 2 particulars;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: batch 1 particulars (第1組詳情) means any of the eligibility-related particulars referred to in section 27(1)(a), (b), (c)(i) or (f) or the particulars of furnaces for burning offerings existing in the columbarium concerned as at the cut-off time;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: batch 2 particulars (第2組詳情) means the particulars of any other facilities (whether or not they are building or building works) existing in the columbarium concerned as at the cut-off time that the operator intended to claim to be relevant to the eligibility-related particulars referred to in section 27(1)(d) or (e);

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.leadIn: the notification scheme is the administrative scheme that was announced by the Secretary at the cut-off time—

subparagraph.content: for the Director or a public officer authorized to act for the purposes of the scheme (either is called a scheme officer) to ascertain the notifiable particulars in the manner described in subsections (2), (3) and (4); and

for facilitating, in the manner described in subsections (5), (6) and (7), the determination of whether any notifiable particulars are proved for the purposes of an application for a specified instrument in respect of a pre-cut-off columbarium.

subsection.leadIn: Under the notification scheme, an operator of a pre-cut-off columbarium was—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: to provide to a scheme officer, in the number of copies and prepared in the manner as the scheme officer determined—

subparagraph.content: a statement of the notifiable particulars; and
any other records relating to the notifiable particulars as the scheme officer determined; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: to give consent to the scheme officer to enter into the columbarium during the following periods to verify the statement and records provided by the operator to ascertain the notifiable particulars—

subparagraph.content: for batch 1 particulars—the period beginning at the cut-off time and ending on 30 June 2014; and
for batch 2 particulars—the period beginning at the cut-off time and ending on 31 August 2014.

subsection.content: On entering into the columbarium and verifying the statement of the notifiable particulars and records provided by the operator and being satisfied with their accuracy, the scheme officer might take photographs and make any other records.

subsection.leadIn: After compiling the records, the scheme officer might, if he or she so desired, prepare—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a statement of the notifiable particulars; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a set of photographs taken and other records made as the scheme officer thought fit, relating to the notifiable particulars (including plans to indicate the location of any facilities).

subsection.content: Subsections (6), (7) and (8) apply to an application for a specified instrument in respect of a pre-cut-off columbarium.

For the purposes of the eligibility-related provisions, a statement of the notifiable particulars prepared, the photographs taken and other records (including plans) made, under the notification scheme by the scheme officer under subsection (4) is evidence of the notifiable particulars in the absence of evidence to the contrary.

subsection.leadIn: To avoid doubt, for the purposes of section 27(1)(d) and (e)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: subsection (6) relates only to proof of the existence of the furnaces for burning offerings or any other facilities in the columbarium as at the cut-off time and the occupation of land by the furnaces or facilities as at that time; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: subsection (6) does not affect the Licensing Board’s determination of whether the furnaces or facilities fall within the essential ancillary facilities referred to in—

subparagraph.content: section 2(1) (definition of columbarium) or section 2(5)(c), (6)(b) or (7)(b); or
paragraph (a)(iii) of the definition of structures certifiable for a pre-cut-off columbarium in section 4(1) of Schedule 2.

subsection.content: For the purposes of an application for a specified instrument in respect of a columbarium that is alleged to be a pre-cut-off columbarium, the Licensing Board may consider evidence of the notifiable particulars other than evidence referred to in subsection (6).

division.name: D4
division.heading: Form and Conditions of Specified Instruments

subdivision.name: SD1
subdivision.heading: Licence for Operating Columbarium (Including Selling Interment Rights)

section.name: s29
section.heading: Licence—form

subsection.leadIn: A licence in respect of a columbarium—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be in the specified form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must have annexed to it a set of the approved plans.

subsection.leadIn: The licence must state—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the person to whom it is issued is authorized to operate, keep, manage or in any other way have control of the columbarium; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that, subject to section 40, the authorization includes an authorization to sell interment rights in respect of the columbarium.

subsection.leadIn: The licence must specify—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the conditions to which it is subject; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: its validity period.

section.name: s30
section.heading: Licence—conditions about ash interment, sale of interment rights, non-compliant structures and management plan
section.leadIn: A licence in respect of a columbarium is subject to the following conditions—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the number of sets of ashes kept in the columbarium must be limited to the ash interment capacity shown in the approved plans;

paragraph.name: ab
paragraph.content: that the number of interment rights that is sold in respect of the columbarium must be limited to the ash interment capacity shown in the approved plans; (Added 18 of 2025 s. 12)

paragraph.name: ac
paragraph.content: that the licence holder must not sell any interment right in respect of the columbarium other than an interment right in respect of a niche that is shown in the approved plans; (Added 18 of 2025 s. 12)

paragraph.name: ad
paragraph.content: that the licence holder must not inter ashes, or cause or permit ashes to be interred, in a niche other than a niche that is shown in the approved plans; (Added 18 of 2025 s. 12)

paragraph.name: ae
paragraph.leadIn: that the licence holder—

subparagraph.content: must not sell any interment right in respect of the columbarium without an authorization under the licence to sell the interment rights; and
must not sell any interment right in respect of the columbarium when the authorization has been revoked or suspended under section 40(1)(a)(ii); (Added 18 of 2025 s. 12)

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: that the licence holder must operate and manage the columbarium in accordance with the approved management plan of the columbarium.

section.name: s31
section.heading: Licence—further conditions
section.leadIn: Without limiting section 13, the Licensing Board may as it thinks fit impose conditions on a licence in respect of a columbarium—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: requiring that the requirements for enforceability of an agreement for the sale of an interment right under section 49 be met in respect of each agreement for the sale of an interment right in respect of the columbarium;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: on measures relating to building safety, fire safety, other safety matters, drainage and sewage, including requiring certificates or reports, by a qualified professional, to be submitted to the Licensing Board at regular intervals; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: on measures for minimizing the environmental nuisance caused to the neighbourhood by the operation of the columbarium.

section.name: s32
section.heading: Exemption—form

subsection.leadIn: An exemption in respect of a pre-cut-off columbarium—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be in the specified form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must have annexed to it a set of the approved plans.

subsection.leadIn: The exemption must state—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: that, subject to the prohibition referred to in paragraph (a), the person is exempted from the requirement under that section for obtaining a licence for operating, keeping, managing or in any other way having control of the columbarium.

subsection.leadIn: The exemption must specify—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the conditions to which it is subject; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: its validity period.

section.name: s33
section.heading: Exemption—conditions about ash interment and non-compliant structures
section.leadIn: An exemption in respect of a pre-cut-off columbarium is subject to all of the following conditions—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: that the non-compliant structures necessary for, or ancillary to, the operation of the columbarium must be limited to the structures certifiable for a pre-cut-off columbarium shown in the approved plans.

section.name: s34
section.heading: Exemption—further conditions
section.leadIn: Without limiting section 13, the Licensing Board may as it thinks fit impose conditions on an exemption in respect of a pre-cut-off columbarium—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on measures relating to building safety, fire safety, other safety matters, drainage and sewage, including requiring certificates or reports, by a qualified professional, to be submitted to the Licensing Board at regular intervals; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on measures for minimizing the environmental nuisance caused to the neighbourhood by the operation of the columbarium.

section.name: s35
section.heading: Temporary suspension of liability—form

subsection.leadIn: A temporary suspension of liability in respect of a pre-cut-off columbarium—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be in the specified form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must have annexed to it a set of the approved plans.

subsection.leadIn: The temporary suspension of liability must state—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: that, subject to the prohibition referred to in paragraph (a), the person’s liability under that section for operating, keeping, managing or in any other way having control of the columbarium without a licence is suspended temporarily.

subsection.leadIn: The temporary suspension of liability must specify—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the conditions to which it is subject; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: its validity period.

section.name: s36
section.heading: Temporary suspension of liability—conditions about steps to be taken, unleased land and non-compliant structures

subsection.leadIn: A temporary suspension of liability in respect of a pre-cut-off columbarium for which an application for the issue of a licence is pending is subject to the condition that its holder must take, with reasonable expedition, all necessary steps towards—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: meeting the requirements referred to in section 18 (whether or not as modified under section 19); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: procuring the issue of the licence before the expiry of the temporary suspension of liability.

subsection.leadIn: A temporary suspension of liability in respect of a pre-cut-off columbarium for which an application for the issue of an exemption is pending is subject to the condition that its holder must take, with reasonable expedition, all necessary steps towards—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: meeting the requirements referred to in section 20; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: procuring the issue of the exemption before the expiry of the temporary suspension of liability.

subsection.leadIn: The temporary suspension of liability is subject to all of the following conditions—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: that the non-compliant structures necessary for, or ancillary to, the operation of the columbarium must be limited to those as shown in the approved plans.

section.name: s37
section.heading: Temporary suspension of liability—further conditions
section.leadIn: Without limiting section 13, the Licensing Board may as it thinks fit impose conditions on a temporary suspension of liability in respect of a pre-cut-off columbarium—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on measures relating to building safety, fire safety, other safety matters, drainage and sewage, including requiring certificates or reports, by a qualified professional, to be submitted to the Licensing Board at regular intervals; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on measures for minimizing the environmental nuisance caused to the neighbourhood by the operation of the columbarium.

section.name: s38
section.heading: Conditions about additional fees, etc.
section.content: Without limiting Subdivisions 1, 2 and 3 and section 13, the Licensing Board may as it thinks fit impose conditions on a specified instrument in respect of a pre-cut-off columbarium restricting the imposition of any additional fees, charges or other sums in respect of an interment right beyond the amounts, or not in accordance with any mechanism for their future revision, specified or otherwise contained in any agreement for the sale of the interment right entered into before the cut-off time.

division.name: D5
division.heading: Supplementary Provisions about Specified Instruments and Related Applications

section.name: s39
section.heading: Transfer of specified instrument

subsection.leadIn: Except as provided in this section, none of the following instruments is transferable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a licence;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an exemption;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: a temporary suspension of liability together with one or both of the following—

subparagraph.content: the related application for the issue of a licence;
the related application for the issue of an exemption.

subsection.content: Subject to subsections (3), (4), (5) and (6), the Licensing Board may, on application, approve the transfer from a person in respect of whom an instrument referred to in subsection (1) is in force to another person (transferee). The fact of the transfer must be endorsed on the instrument.

subsection.leadIn: The application—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be made, in writing, to the Licensing Board in the specified form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: must be accompanied by the information, certificates and other documents—

subparagraph.content: specified in the application form; or
otherwise reasonably required by the Licensing Board.

subsection.leadIn: The Licensing Board may refuse an application for the transfer of an instrument referred to in subsection (1) if the transferee fails to prove to the satisfaction of the Licensing Board that the transferee—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: holds the columbarium premises directly from the Government under a lease; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has the right to continue to use the columbarium premises as mentioned in section 19(3)(b) or 20 (1)(h)(ii) (as the case requires).

subsection.leadIn: The Licensing Board may also refuse an application for the transfer of an instrument referred to in subsection (1) if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a notice of revocation or suspension has been given by the Licensing Board under section 40 in respect of the instrument; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an application for the renewal or extension of the instrument has been refused.

subsection.content: On approving the transfer of an instrument referred to in subsection (1), the Licensing Board may vary the conditions to which the instrument is subject or impose new conditions.

subsection.leadIn: On determining an application made under this section, the Licensing Board must notify the applicant in writing of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Licensing Board’s decision; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the application is refused—the reasons for the refusal.

subsection.leadIn: If the Licensing Board exercises its power under subsection (6) to vary the conditions to which an instrument referred to in subsection (1) is subject or impose new conditions, the Licensing Board must notify the transferee in writing of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Licensing Board’s decision;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the reasons for the decision; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the date on which the decision is to take effect.

subsection.content: Despite the Transfer of Businesses (Protection of Creditors) Ordinance (Cap. 49) and any rules of common law, a transferee is liable for all debts and obligations (including all outstanding, subsisting and future liabilities) in relation to each agreement for sale of an interment right entered into before the transfer by the person from whom an instrument referred to in subsection (1) is transferred and, accordingly, any such agreement may, after the transfer, be enforced by the purchaser against the transferee.

A transferee may be indemnified by the person from whom an instrument referred to in subsection (1) is transferred for all amounts for which the transferee is made liable under subsection (9) and for which the transferee would not otherwise be liable, and the amount of the indemnity may be recovered by civil proceedings as a debt or liquidated demand.

subsection.leadIn: In this section, a reference to transfer includes—

paragraph.name: a
b
