paragraph.content: if the person from whom an instrument referred to in subsection (1) is transferred is a partner in a partnership and there is a change of any partner in the partnership (whether that person or another partner)—a reference to a transfer from that person to a partner in the new partnership (whether to that person, if that person remains as a partner in the new partnership, or to another partner), and the reference to another person in subsection (2) is to be construed accordingly.

subsection.content: The holder of a specified instrument who purports to transfer the instrument without the Licensing Board’s approval under this section commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 3 months.

section.name: s40
section.heading: Revocation, suspension, refusal to renew or extend and variation of conditions

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsections (2) and (3), the Licensing Board may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: revoke, or suspend for a period the Licensing Board thinks fit—

subparagraph.content: a licence; or
the authorization under a licence to sell interment rights in respect of the columbarium concerned;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: revoke, or suspend for a period the Licensing Board thinks fit, an exemption or temporary suspension of liability;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: refuse to renew a licence or exemption or refuse to extend a temporary suspension of liability;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: vary any conditions to which any of the following is subject or impose new conditions on it—

subparagraph.content: a licence;
the authorization under a licence to sell interment rights in respect of the columbarium concerned;
an exemption;
a temporary suspension of liability.

subsection.leadIn: The Licensing Board may exercise the powers under subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if, at the time when the Licensing Board considers exercising the powers in respect of the columbarium, circumstances exist that would have entitled the Licensing Board to refuse an application for the issue of the specified instrument under section 18 (whether or not as modified under section 19) or section 20, 20A or 21 had it been necessary to determine such an application at that time; (Amended 18 of 2025 s. 9)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if the person holding the specified instrument (instrument holder) has failed to comply with—

subparagraph.content: a condition to which the instrument is subject; or
an enforcement notice served under section 64;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the application on the basis of which the specified instrument has been issued, renewed or extended, or a plan submitted in connection with such an application, contains information that is false or misleading in a material particular;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: if the instrument holder has been convicted of an offence under this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: if it appears to the Licensing Board that—

subparagraph.content: the columbarium has ceased to be operated as such or to exist; or
the instrument holder has ceased to operate the columbarium;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: if the instrument holder is a body corporate other than a company or (where the instrument holder is a partner in a partnership) if any partner in the partnership is a body corporate other than a company, and the body corporate is dissolved;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.leadIn: if the instrument holder is a company or (where the instrument holder is a partner in a partnership) if any partner in the partnership is a company, and—

subparagraph.content: a resolution for voluntary winding up (as defined by section 228(2) of the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32)) is passed by the company;
the company is dissolved under the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622); or

where the company is a registered non-Hong Kong company (as defined by section 2(1) of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622))—the company’s name has been struck off the Companies Register under section 798 of that Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.leadIn: if a natural person who is the instrument holder, or is a partner in a partnership who is the instrument holder or is any other partner in that partnership—

subparagraph.content: dies;
is adjudicated bankrupt within the meaning of the Bankruptcy Ordinance (Cap. 6) or has entered into a composition or arrangement with his or her creditors without paying the creditors in full; or
is serving a sentence of imprisonment, whether in Hong Kong or elsewhere, at any time during the validity period of the specified instrument.

subsection.content: The Licensing Board may also exercise the powers under subsection (1)(d) if the Licensing Board considers it necessary or expedient to do so for the better regulation, supervision or control of the columbarium concerned.

subsection.leadIn: If the Licensing Board exercises any power under this section in respect of a specified instrument held by a person, the Licensing Board must notify the person in writing of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Licensing Board’s decision;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the reasons for the decision; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the date on which the decision is to take effect.

section.name: s41
section.heading: Variation of condition on application by holder of specified instrument

subsection.content: The Licensing Board may, on application by the holder of a specified instrument showing sufficient cause to its satisfaction, vary any conditions to which the instrument is subject, by an endorsement on the instrument.

subsection.leadIn: The application—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be made, in writing, to the Licensing Board in the specified form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: must be accompanied by—

subparagraph.content: if applicable—plans that comply with the requirements in section 25 and, where appropriate, section 27(2); and

subparagraph.leadIn: the information, certificates and other documents—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: specified in the application form; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: otherwise reasonably required by the Licensing Board.

subsection.leadIn: On determining an application made under this section, the Licensing Board must notify the applicant in writing of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Licensing Board’s decision; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the application is refused—the reasons for the refusal.

section.name: s42
section.heading: Variation of approved plans, endorsed registers, etc.

subsection.content: The Licensing Board may, in the circumstances specified in subsection (3), vary any of the particulars or matters specified in subsection (2) in respect of a columbarium.

subsection.leadIn: The particulars or matters are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the following particulars shown in the approved plans of a columbarium—

subparagraph.content: particulars specified in section 27(1);
particulars specified in section 27(3);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: particulars contained in an endorsed register of a pre-cut-off columbarium; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: matters covered in the approved management plan of a columbarium.

subsection.leadIn: The Licensing Board may vary a particular or matter in respect of a columbarium under subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if, at the time when the Licensing Board considers exercising the power in respect of the columbarium, circumstances exist that would have entitled the Licensing Board to approve or endorse the plans, register or management plan with the particulars or matters as varied had it been necessary to determine at that time whether to approve or endorse the plans, register or management plan; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the Licensing Board considers that the variation is necessary or expedient for the better regulation, supervision or control of the columbarium.

subsection.leadIn: If the Licensing Board varies any particular or matter in respect of a columbarium under subsection(1), the Licensing Board must notify the person holding the specified instrument in respect of the columbarium in writing of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Licensing Board’s decision;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the reasons for the decision; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the date on which the decision is to take effect.

section.name: s43
section.heading: Licensing Board’s decision may be suspended from operation

subsection.leadIn: If a person in respect of whom the Licensing Board made a decision under section 40(1) or 42(1) appeals against the decision under section 84, the Licensing Board—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may, on application by the person, suspend the operation of the decision, pending the determination of the appeal; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may, on its volition, suspend the operation of the decision, pending the determination of the appeal.

subsection.leadIn: An application under subsection (1)(a)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be made, in writing, to the Licensing Board within 7 days after the date of the lodging of the notice of appeal by that person; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must set out the grounds of the application.

subsection.content: The decision in respect of which an application under subsection (1)(a) is made is suspended in its operation until the Licensing Board determines the application.

subsection.leadIn: On determining an application made under subsection (1)(a), the Licensing Board must notify the person in writing of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Licensing Board’s decision; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the application is refused—the reasons for the refusal.

section.name: s44
section.heading: Notification of changes

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person has made an application for a specified instrument; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a change occurs that materially affects the accuracy of the information that the person has provided in connection with the application,

subsection.continued: the person must notify the Licensing Board of the change, in writing, within 14 days after the date on which the change occurs.

subsection.content: A change referred to in subsection (1)(b) includes (but is not limited to) a change of any director, manager, company secretary or other similar officer of the applicant. (Amended 18 of 2025 s. 19)

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a specified instrument has been issued, renewed or extended; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a change occurs that materially affects the accuracy of the information that the holder of the specified instrument has provided in connection with the application on the basis of which the specified instrument has been issued, renewed or extended, the holder must—

subparagraph.content: notify the Licensing Board of the change, in writing, within 14 days after the date on which the change occurs; and
provide the information required by the Licensing Board within the time specified by it.

subsection.content: A change referred to in subsection (3)(b) includes (but is not limited to) a change of any director, manager, company secretary or other similar officer of the holder of the specified instrument. (Amended 18 of 2025 s. 19)

If the holder of a specified instrument in respect of a columbarium decides to cease operating the columbarium, the holder must notify the Licensing Board of the decision, in writing, within 14 days after the date of the decision.
A person who contravenes subsection (1), (3) or (5) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 3 months.

section.name: s45
section.heading: Further provisions on applications relating to specified instruments
section.content: Schedule 3 (which contains further provisions on applications relating to specified instruments under this Part) has effect.

section.name: s46
section.heading: Certificate of columbarium use

subsection.content: As soon as the Licensing Board has issued a specified instrument to a person (instrument holder) in respect of any premises for which a land register has been kept under the Land Registration Ordinance (Cap. 128), the Licensing Board must issue a certificate of columbarium use.

subsection.leadIn: The certificate—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: must state—

subparagraph.content: that the premises are a columbarium to which this Ordinance applies;
that a specified instrument is issued in respect of the columbarium; and
the name of the instrument holder; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must state that the provisions of Part 7 and Schedule 5 on obligations to carry out the prescribed ash disposal procedures and the power of a specified officer to apply for an occupation order under section 76 apply to the columbarium.

subsection.content: As soon as reasonably practicable after the certificate is issued, the Licensing Board must register the certificate against the premises in the Land Registry.

section.name: s47
section.heading: Register of private columbaria

subsection.content: The Licensing Board must keep a register of private columbaria, listing each columbarium in respect of which a specified instrument is in force.
The register is to be kept in the form, and containing the particulars, that the Licensing Board considers appropriate.
The Licensing Board may keep separate parts under the register in respect of different types of columbaria.

subsection.leadIn: The register—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be kept at a place determined by the Licensing Board; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must be available for inspection by the general public during normal office hours free of charge.

division.name: D1
division.heading: Requirements about Agreement for Sale of Interment Rights

section.name: s48
section.heading: Interpretation of Division 1 of Part 5

subsection.leadIn: In this Division—
subsection.def: purchaser (買方)—see section 49(1);
seller (賣方)—see section 49(1).

subsection.content: This Division applies to an agreement for the sale of an interment right entered into on or after the enactment date.

section.name: s49
section.heading: Certain agreement for sale of interment right unenforceable against purchaser

subsection.content: This section applies if a person (seller) enters into an agreement with another person (purchaser) for the sale, to the purchaser, of an interment right in respect of a columbarium, whether or not to the purchaser as dedicated person.

subsection.leadIn: The agreement is not enforceable against the purchaser if the seller purports to sell under the agreement an interment right that the seller is not entitled to sell—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: where the columbarium premises are held directly from the Government under a lease—by selling an interment right in respect of the premises for a term that extends beyond the term of the lease;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where the columbarium premises are occupied under a short term tenancy granted by the Government—by selling an interment right in respect of the premises otherwise than for payment payable on the same periodic basis as that for the payment of rent for the short term tenancy; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: where the columbarium premises are occupied under a tenancy by an agreement entered into between private parties for the letting or leasing of the premises—by selling an interment right in respect of the premises for a term that extends beyond the term of the tenancy.

subsection.leadIn: The agreement is not enforceable against the purchaser unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the seller held a licence in respect of the columbarium at the time when the agreement was entered into and the licence is still in force at the time of enforcing the agreement;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the agreement is in writing and was signed by both the seller and the purchaser;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: the agreement sets out, in clear language—

subparagraph.content: the information and recommendations prescribed in Part 1 of Schedule 4; and
the essential terms prescribed in Part 2 of that Schedule;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the agreement sets out the purchaser’s cancellation rights under section 50;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the agreement includes a term on whether and, if so, on what conditions the purchaser’s cancellation rights under section 50 may be exercised after the interment right has been exercised;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: before the purchaser entered into the agreement, the seller has explained to the purchaser the information, recommendations and essential terms as set out in the agreement;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: the seller obtained the purchaser’s acknowledgement, in writing, that the explanation referred to in paragraph (f) was given to the purchaser;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.leadIn: the seller delivered to the purchaser a copy of the agreement as soon as possible after it was signed by all parties, which delivery must be effected—

subparagraph.content: by personal delivery to the purchaser;
by registered post to the purchaser; or
in any other manner if receipt of the copy by the purchaser can be proved; and

paragraph.content: any other requirements specified by the Licensing Board are met.

subsection.leadIn: A purchaser under an agreement that is not enforceable under subsection (2) or (3) may bring an action in a court to recover any amounts paid under the agreement together with costs if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the purchaser has given a notice of cancellation under section 50(1) or (2); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the amount has not been refunded to the purchaser under section 50(3).

subsection.content: Subsection (4) does not affect, limit or diminish any rights of a purchaser to claim under an agreement for the sale of an interment right under the common law rules or equitable principles or any other Ordinance.

section.name: s50
section.heading: Cancellation of unenforceable agreement

subsection.content: A purchaser under an agreement that is not enforceable under section 49(2) or (3)(a), (b) or (c) may cancel the agreement at any time after it is entered into by giving the seller a written notice of cancellation.

A purchaser under an agreement that is not enforceable under section 49(3)(d), (e), (f), (g), (h) or (i) may cancel the agreement within 6 months after the date of the agreement by giving the seller a written notice of cancellation.
A seller who receives a notice of cancellation under subsection (1) or (2) must, within 30 days after the date of receiving the notice, refund to the purchaser all money received under the agreement.
If the interment right has been exercised, subsections (1), (2) and (3) apply subject to the term of the agreement referred to in section 49(3)(e).

This section applies in the case of a transfer approved under section 39 as if a reference to seller in subsections (1), (2) and (3) were a reference to the transferee within the meaning of section 39(2).

section.name: s51
section.heading: Record keeping

subsection.content: A person holding a licence in respect of a columbarium must keep copies of all agreements for the sale of interment rights in respect of the columbarium (including agreements avoided or cancelled) until the expiry of 6 years beginning on the date the agreement is fully performed or is avoided or cancelled.

subsection.leadIn: A person holding a licence in respect of a columbarium—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must keep a register of agreements for the sale of interment rights in respect of the columbarium; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must enter the specified particulars of each of the agreements into the register within the specified period.

subsection.content: A person holding a licence in respect of a columbarium must make the copies of agreements kept under subsection (1), and the register kept under subsection (2), in respect of the columbarium available for inspection, on request, by the Director or an authorized officer.

subsection.leadIn: A person holding a specified instrument in respect of a columbarium must keep a record—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on interment and disinterment of ashes in and from the columbarium; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: of the contact details of—

subparagraph.content: authorized representatives; and
purchasers of the interment rights,

paragraph.continued: in respect of ashes interred in the columbarium.

subsection.content: A person holding a specified instrument in respect of a columbarium must make the record kept under subsection (4) in respect of the columbarium available for inspection, on request, by the Director or an authorized officer.
A person who contravenes subsection (1), (2), (3), (4) or (5) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.leadIn: In subsection (2)(b)—
subsection.def: specified (指明) means specified by the Licensing Board.

division.name: D2
division.heading: Duties to Exhibit Specified Instruments and Notices, not to Deviate from Approved Plans, etc.

section.name: s52
section.heading: Specified instruments and notices to be exhibited

subsection.content: A person who holds a specified instrument in respect of a columbarium must exhibit it at a conspicuous place in the columbarium.

A person who holds an exemption or temporary suspension of liability in respect of a pre-cut-off columbarium must exhibit at a conspicuous place in the columbarium a notice to the effect that any sale of an interment right in respect of the columbarium is an offence under section 11.

subsection.leadIn: A person must not—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: alter, deface or make any erasure on a specified instrument; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: use, or have in the person’s possession with a view to using, a specified instrument on which an erasure has been made or which has been wilfully altered or defaced in any way.

subsection.content: A person who contravenes subsection (1), (2) or (3) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 3 months.

section.name: s53
section.heading: No alteration or addition in material deviation from approved plans, etc.

subsection.content: Except with the written permission of the Licensing Board, a person holding a specified instrument in respect of a columbarium must not cause or permit any alteration or addition to the columbarium premises that would result in material deviation from the approved plans of the columbarium.
A person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 6 months.
An application for permission for the purposes of subsection (1) must be accompanied by plans that comply with the requirements in section 25 and, where appropriate, section 27(2).

subsection.leadIn: On determining an application for permission for the purposes of subsection (1), the Licensing Board must notify the applicant in writing of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Licensing Board’s decision; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the application is refused—the reasons for the refusal.

section.name: s54
section.heading: Number of sets of ashes interred and number of interment rights sold restricted

subsection.content: The holder of a licence in respect of a columbarium must ensure that the number of sets of ashes kept in niches, the number of those kept otherwise than in niches, and the number of interment rights sold in respect of the columbarium, are limited to the ash interment capacity shown in the approved plans. (Amended 18 of 2025 s. 13)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: The holder of a licence in respect of a columbarium must not sell any interment right in respect of the columbarium other than an interment right in respect of a niche that is shown in the approved plans. (Added 18 of 2025 s. 13)

subsection.name: 1B
subsection.content: The holder of a licence in respect of a columbarium must not inter ashes, or cause or permit ashes to be interred, in a niche other than a niche that is shown in the approved plans. (Added 18 of 2025 s. 13)

Subject to subsection (3), the holder of an exemption in respect of a pre-cut-off columbarium must ensure that the number of sets of ashes kept in the columbarium is limited to the total number of sets of ashes that were kept in the columbarium as at the cut-off time, as shown in the approved plans.

subsection.leadIn: The holder of an exemption does not contravene subsection (2) if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: any increase in the total number of sets of ashes since the cut-off time is caused only by—

subparagraph.content: sets of ashes interred in the columbarium before the enactment date; or
sets of ashes interred in the columbarium under section 55 or 57; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: for each set of ashes mentioned in paragraph (a)(i), it is either—

subparagraph.leadIn: ashes interred or to be interred in a niche, where—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the interment right in respect of the niche was sold before the cut-off time; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: the name of the dedicated person has been entered into an endorsed register; or
ashes interred in a religious ash pagoda (as defined by section 57(14)), where no fees, charges or other sums were paid, or are payable, for the interment of ashes.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (5), the holder of a temporary suspension of liability in respect of a pre-cut-off columbarium must ensure that the number of sets of ashes kept in the columbarium is limited to the total number of sets of ashes that were kept in the columbarium as at the following time, as shown in the approved plans—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if an application for the issue of a licence (but no application for the issue of an exemption) is pending in respect of the columbarium—the beginning of the enactment date; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if an application for the issue of an exemption is pending in respect of the columbarium—the cut-off time.

subsection.leadIn: The holder of a temporary suspension of liability does not contravene subsection (4)(b) if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any increase in the total number of sets of ashes since the cut-off time is caused only by sets of ashes interred in the columbarium before the enactment date (new sets of ashes); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: each new set of ashes is either—

subparagraph.content: ashes interred or to be interred in a niche, where the interment right in respect of the niche was sold before the cut-off time; or
ashes interred in a religious ash pagoda (as defined by section 57(14)), where no fees, charges or other sums were paid, or are payable, for the interment of ashes.

subsection.leadIn: A person who contravenes subsection (1), (1A), (1B), (2) or (4) commits an offence and is liable— (Amended 18 of 2025 s. 13)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine of $2,000,000 and to imprisonment for 6 months; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $5,000,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years. (Amended 18 of 2025 s. 13)

section.name: s55
section.heading: Interment of ashes by exercising interment right sold
section.leadIn: The ashes of a dedicated person may be interred in a niche in a pre-cut-off columbarium in respect of which an exemption is in force if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the interment right in respect of the niche was sold before the cut-off time, but has not been exercised or (if more than one set of ashes may be interred in that niche) has only been exercised partially; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the name of the dedicated person has been entered into an endorsed register.

section.name: s56
section.heading: Records on unused or partially used niches, etc.

subsection.leadIn: The holder of an exemption in respect of a pre-cut-off columbarium must not replace the name of a dedicated person contained in an endorsed register, or cause such a name to be replaced, by the name of another person unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the purchaser so requests;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that other person is a relative (as defined by section 6(2) of Schedule 5) of the dedicated person, whether or not living, and the purchaser has made a statutory declaration to confirm that fact; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the arrangements for effecting changes of the dedicated person set out in the agreement for the sale of the interment right (if applicable) have been followed.

subsection.leadIn: The holder of an exemption in respect of a pre-cut-off columbarium must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: update the endorsed register as soon as practicable after effecting the changes of a dedicated person;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: notify the Director of the change, in writing, within 10 working days after the date on which the change is effected; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: make the updated register available for inspection, on request, by the Director or an authorized officer.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name of a dedicated person contained in an endorsed register is replaced by the name of another person otherwise than in accordance with subsection (1); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the name of the dedicated person shown on the niche in the pre-cut-off columbarium is different from that entered into such a register,

subsection.continued: the holder of an exemption in respect of the columbarium commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine of $500,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years.

subsection.content: A person who contravenes subsection (2) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s57
section.heading: Interment of ashes in religious ash pagodas

subsection.content: If a pre-cut-off columbarium in respect of which an exemption is in force is a columbarium of a Chinese temple specified under subsection (2), the ashes of the religious practitioners of that temple may be interred in a religious ash pagoda specified under that subsection after the publication of the notice under that subsection.

subsection.leadIn: The Secretary for Home and Youth Affairs must, by notice published in the Gazette, specify for the purposes of subsection (1)— (Amended L.N. 144 of 2022)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the columbaria of Chinese temples to which that subsection applies;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the religious ash pagodas in each of those columbaria in which ashes may be interred under that subsection;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the number of sets of ashes that may be interred under that subsection;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the location of those religious ash pagodas (as shown in the approved plans) in which ashes may be interred under that subsection; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the location and serial numbering of the niches (according to the ash interment layout as shown in the approved plans) in which ashes may be interred under that subsection.

subsection.content: The number of sets of ashes specified under subsection (2) in respect of a pre-cut-off columbarium must not exceed 1 000.

The holder of an exemption in respect of a pre-cut-off columbarium must ensure that the number of sets of ashes that are interred in the columbarium under subsection (1) is limited to the number of sets of ashes specified by the Secretary for Home and Youth Affairs under subsection (2)(c). (Amended L.N. 144 of 2022)
No fees, charges or other sums may be payable for interment of ashes under subsection (1).

Without limiting sections 32, 33 and 34, a pre-cut-off columbarium must comply with any requirement or condition that the Secretary for Home and Youth Affairs may impose for the purpose of determining whether the columbarium is, or continues to be, eligible or not to be specified under subsection (2). (Amended L.N. 144 of 2022)

subsection.leadIn: If a pre-cut-off columbarium has failed to comply with any requirement or condition imposed under subsection (6) or the Secretary for Home and Youth Affairs is satisfied that a pre-cut-off columbarium is no longer eligible to be specified under subsection (2), he or she— (Amended L.N. 144 of 2022)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may decide that the columbarium is to cease to be specified under subsection (2); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must notify his or her decision in the Gazette.

subsection.content: A notice published in the Gazette under subsection (2) or (7) is not subsidiary legislation.

subsection.leadIn: The holder of an exemption in respect of a pre-cut-off columbarium that is a columbarium of a Chinese temple specified under subsection (2) must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: keep a register of all the religious practitioners of that temple, whose ashes are interred in the religious ash pagoda, in compliance with any requirement or condition imposed under subsection (6); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: make the register available for inspection, on request, by the Secretary for Home and Youth Affairs. (Amended L.N. 144 of 2022)

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this section, the Secretary for Home and Youth Affairs or a public officer authorized by him or her in writing has power to do all or any of the following things— (Amended L.N. 144 of 2022)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to enter and inspect at all reasonable times a columbarium of a Chinese temple specified under subsection (2);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: to require the holder of the exemption—

subparagraph.content: to produce a book, document or any other article; or
to furnish any information,

paragraph.continued: in that holder’s possession that relates to any matter referred to in subsection (4), (6) or (9);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to conduct any examination and inquiry that may be necessary for ascertaining whether subsection (4), (6) or (9) is being, or has been, complied with.

subsection.leadIn: A person commits an offence if the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: wilfully obstructs the exercise of a power under subsection (10)(a) or (c); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: without reasonable excuse, fails to produce a book, document or article required to be produced, or furnish information required to be furnished, under subsection (10)(b).

subsection.content: A person who commits an offence under subsection (11) is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 6 months.
A person who contravenes subsection (4) or (9) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: Chinese temple (華人廟宇) has the meaning given by section 2 of the Chinese Temples Ordinance (Cap. 153);

religious ash pagoda (宗教骨灰塔), in relation to a pre-cut-off columbarium that is a columbarium of a Chinese temple, means any part of that columbarium (whether a structure or otherwise) that is used for the interment of the ashes of the religious practitioners of that temple;

religious practitioners (修行者), in relation to a Chinese temple, includes the Buddhist monks and nuns and Taoist priests and priestesses (as the case requires) residing and serving in that temple immediately before death (but excludes their family members and any other persons related to that temple, whether as followers, donors or otherwise of that temple).

section.name: s58
section.heading: Duty to maintain columbarium

subsection.content: A person holding a specified instrument in respect of a columbarium must keep the columbarium clean and in good repair.
A person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 2 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s59
section.heading: Power to inspect columbaria, etc.

subsection.leadIn: The Director or an authorized officer has power to do all or any of the things set out in subsection (2) for the purposes of ascertaining whether all or any of the following is being, or has been, complied with—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the conditions of a specified instrument;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the approved management plan of a columbarium.

subsection.leadIn: The things referred to in subsection (1) are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to enter and inspect at all reasonable times a columbarium in respect of which a specified instrument is in force;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: to require a person taking part in the operation or management of the columbarium—

subparagraph.content: to produce a book, document or any other article in the person’s possession that relates to the operation or management of the columbarium or to any other activity in respect of the columbarium; or
to furnish any information in the person’s possession that relates to the operation, management or activity;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to inspect, examine and copy any such book, document or article;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: to conduct any examination and inquiry that the Director or authorized officer considers necessary;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: to exercise any other powers that may be necessary for giving effect to the provisions of this Ordinance.

subsection.content: A person holding a specified instrument and the employees, servants or agents of the person must provide the assistance and information required by the Director or an authorized officer for exercising the powers under this section.

section.name: s60
section.heading: Power to enter and search, etc.

subsection.content: If satisfied by information on oath that there are reasonable grounds for suspecting that there is in any premises any thing which is or contains, or which is likely to be or to contain, evidence of an offence under this Ordinance, a magistrate may issue a search warrant in respect of the premises.

subsection.leadIn: The search warrant may authorize the Director or an authorized officer to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: break into and forcibly enter the premises and search the premises;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: seize, remove or impound any thing which appears to the Director or authorized officer to be or to contain, or to be likely to be or to contain, evidence of an offence under this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: remove by force a person or thing obstructing the Director or authorized officer in the exercise of a power conferred on the Director or authorized officer by this section; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: detain a person found on the premises until the premises have been searched.

subsection.leadIn: The Director or an authorized officer may exercise any of the powers referred to in subsection (2) in respect of any premises without a search warrant issued under subsection (1) if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: there are reasonable grounds for suspecting that there is in the premises any thing which is or contains, or which is likely to be or to contain, evidence of an offence under this Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the delay necessary to obtain a search warrant could result in the loss or destruction of evidence or for any other reason it would not be reasonably practicable to obtain a search warrant.

subsection.content: If the Director or an authorized officer seizes, removes or impounds any thing under subsection (2)(b) (or by the exercise under subsection (3) of the powers referred to in subsection (2)(b)), the Director or authorized officer must post at a conspicuous place outside the premises a notice declaring the seizure, removal or impoundment.

section.name: s61
section.heading: Power of arrest

subsection.content: If the Director or an authorized officer reasonably suspects that a person has committed or is committing an offence under this Ordinance, the Director or authorized officer may arrest the person without a warrant.

subsection.leadIn: The Director or an authorized officer may use all reasonable means necessary to make the arrest if the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: forcibly resists the attempt of the Director or authorized officer to arrest the person; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: attempts to evade the arrest.

subsection.content: If the Director or an authorized officer arrests a person under this section, the Director or authorized officer must immediately take the person to the nearest police station or hand the person over to the custody of a police officer, to be dealt with in accordance with the Police Force Ordinance (Cap. 232).

section.name: s62
section.heading: Offence of obstruction of entry, inspection, arrest, etc.

subsection.leadIn: A person commits an offence if the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: wilfully obstructs the exercise of a power under section 59(2)(a), (c) or (d), 60 or 61; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: without reasonable excuse, fails to produce a book, document or article required to be produced under section 59(2)(b) or furnish information required to be furnished under that section.

subsection.content: A person who commits an offence under subsection (1) is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s63
section.heading: Disposal of thing seized, removed or impounded

subsection.content: If any thing seized, removed or impounded under section 60(2)(b) (or by the exercise under section 60(3) of the powers referred to in section 60(2)(b)) is required, or likely to be required, for production in evidence in any proceedings under this Ordinance, the Director may retain the thing until the proceedings are abandoned or determined.

subsection.leadIn: The Director must, after the proceedings are abandoned or determined—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: return the thing as ordered by the court; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if no court order is made—give a notice in writing to the owner of the thing, stating that—

subparagraph.content: the owner may collect the thing from the Director within 60 days after the date of the notice; and

subparagraph.leadIn: unless the owner collects the thing within 60 days after the date of the notice, it—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: is to become the property of the Government, free from all liens, claims or encumbrances; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: may be sold or otherwise disposed of in a manner that the Director thinks fit.

subsection.leadIn: If the owner of the thing has not collected the thing within the 60 days stated in the notice, the thing—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is to become the property of the Government, free from all liens, claims or encumbrances; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may be sold or otherwise disposed of in a manner that the Director thinks fit.

section.name: s64
section.heading: Enforcement notice

subsection.leadIn: The Director may, by notice (enforcement notice) served on the holder of a specified instrument in respect of a columbarium (recipient), require the recipient to do one or more of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to end a contravention of a condition to which the instrument is subject;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to remedy the consequences of such a contravention;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to prevent the recurrence of such a contravention.

subsection.leadIn: The enforcement notice must state—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the particulars of the contravention concerned and (if applicable) the time within which the contravention must end;

paragraph.name: b
c
d
paragraph.content: that a failure, without reasonable excuse, to comply with the notice is an offence; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: if paragraph (b) or (c) applies—

subparagraph.content: that, if the recipient fails to take the action referred to in that paragraph within the stated time, the Director may arrange for any action that the Director considers necessary or desirable to be taken to remedy the consequences of the contravention or to prevent the recurrence of the contravention; and
that the recipient will be liable for the expenses of taking the action.

subsection.leadIn: The recipient of an enforcement notice who, without reasonable excuse, fails to comply with the notice commits an offence and is liable— (Amended 18 of 2025 s. 14)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine of $500,000 and to imprisonment for 6 months; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $5,000,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years. (Amended 18 of 2025 s. 14)

subsection.content: If the recipient of an enforcement notice fails to take the action stated in the notice within the stated time for remedying the consequences of a contravention stated in the notice or for preventing the recurrence of such a contravention, the Director may arrange for any action that the Director considers necessary or desirable to be taken to remedy the consequences of the contravention or to prevent the recurrence of the contravention.
The expenses of any action taken under subsection (4) are recoverable as a civil debt from the recipient of the enforcement notice.

An appeal under section 84 against a decision to serve an enforcement notice does not suspend the operation of the decision, pending the determination of the appeal, unless the Director decides otherwise.

part.name: P7
part.heading: Ash Disposal and Cessation of Columbaria

section.name: s65
section.heading: Interpretation of Part 7
section.content: In this Part, a reference to carrying out the prescribed ash disposal procedures is to be construed in accordance with section 7 of Schedule 5.

section.name: s66
section.heading: Application of Part 7
section.content: This Part applies to any disposal of ashes interred in a columbarium, or abandonment of a columbarium, by a person on or after the enactment date, whether or not the receipt of the ashes for interment in the columbarium or the operation, keeping, management or control of the columbarium by the person occurs before that day.

section.name: s67
section.heading: General principles
section.content: A person disposing of ashes interred in a columbarium must do so having regard to the respect for, and the dignity of, the deceased persons concerned.

section.name: s68
section.heading: Operator’s obligations in disposal of ashes

subsection.content: A person who has operated, kept, managed or in any other way had control of a columbarium must not improperly dispose of ashes interred in the columbarium.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (1), a person who disposes of ashes interred in a columbarium does so improperly unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the disposal complies with the requirements specified in subsection (3); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the disposal forms part of the prescribed ash disposal procedures carried out in respect of the columbarium.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (2)(a), the requirements are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: either—

subparagraph.content: the person holds a specified instrument in respect of the columbarium; or
the columbarium was in operation immediately before the enactment date, and the ashes are disposed of within the grace period;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the ashes are disposed of not because of cessation of operation of the columbarium;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the ashes are disposed of in accordance with the terms of any agreement for the sale of an interment right in respect of the ashes; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: the following particulars of disposal are entered into the record on interment and disinterment of ashes kept under section 51(4) (if paragraph (a)(i) applies), or into a record of ash disposal (if paragraph (a)(ii) applies)—

subparagraph.content: the name of the dedicated person;

subparagraph.leadIn: if the ashes are interred in a niche—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the location and serial numbering of the niche;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: photos showing the exterior and interior of the niche before disposal; and

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: the number of containers of ashes disinterred from the niche;

subparagraph.leadIn: if the ashes are interred in an area other than a niche—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the location of the area;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: photos showing the area before disposal; and

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: the number of containers of ashes disinterred from the area;

the name, the Hong Kong identity card number (if applicable) and the contact details of the person who has collected the ashes (together with their container) and any items interred together with the ashes in the same container (if applicable);
the date of return of the ashes, container and items (if any) to the person referred to in subparagraph (iv); and

subparagraph.leadIn: any—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: breach of the agreement for the sale of the interment right on the part of the purchaser or authorized representative; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: other reason for the disposal.

subsection.content: Without affecting sections 10 and 11, a person who operates, keeps, manages or in any other way has control of a columbarium in the circumstances specified in subsection (5) is regarded, for the purposes of subsection (1), as having improperly disposed of ashes interred in the columbarium, unless the person carries out the prescribed ash disposal procedures in respect of the columbarium.

subsection.leadIn: The circumstances are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for a columbarium that was in operation immediately before the enactment date—that the columbarium is in operation, after the grace period, while no specified instrument is in force in respect of it; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for any other columbarium—that the columbarium is in operation while no specified instrument is in force in respect of it.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: grace period (寬限期) means the period beginning on the enactment date and ending—(a)on the expiry of 9 months beginning on the enactment date; or(b)if an application is made for a temporary suspension of liability by the expiry of those 9 months—at the time when the application is finally disposed of or withdrawn.

subsection.leadIn: If an application referred to in paragraph (b) of the definition of grace period in subsection (6) is refused, it is finally disposed of at the later of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: at the time the period within which an appeal may be lodged under section 84 against the refusal expires without an appeal having been lodged;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if an appeal has been lodged within time—at the time the appeal is determined or withdrawn.

subsection.content: The Secretary may, by notice published in the Gazette, amend subsection (6) by substituting another period for any period specified in that subsection.

section.name: s69
section.heading: Abandonment of columbarium operated without specified instrument issued

subsection.content: A person who has operated, kept, managed or in any other way had control of a columbarium, in respect of which no specified instrument has been issued, must not abandon the columbarium.

If the Director or an authorized officer suspects that a columbarium in respect of which no specified instrument is issued is not in operation, the Director or authorized officer may give a notice about the suspected abandonment (notice about suspected abandonment).

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (2), the notice about suspected abandonment must be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: published in the Gazette once in each of 2 consecutive months; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: posted at a conspicuous place outside the columbarium.

subsection.leadIn: The notice about suspected abandonment must warn any person who has operated, kept, managed or in any other way had control of the columbarium that, unless within 2 months after the date of the notice, a person gives a specified response—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person who has operated, kept, managed or in any other way had control of the columbarium is liable to be prosecuted for an offence under section 74; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a specified officer may apply for an occupation order under section 76 to enable the officer to carry out the steps that the officer considers necessary for disposal of ashes in respect of the columbarium.

subsection.leadIn: A person referred to in subsection (1) abandons the columbarium if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the notice about suspected abandonment has been given; but

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person fails to give a specified response within 2 months after the date of the notice about suspected abandonment.

subsection.content: A person who, without lawful authority or reasonable excuse, removes or defaces the notice about suspected abandonment posted under subsection (3)(b) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: specified response (指明回應) has the meaning given by section 71.

section.name: s70
section.heading: Abandonment of columbarium if specified instrument issued

subsection.content: A person (instrument holder) whose specified instrument in respect of a columbarium is in force, has expired without being renewed or extended, or is revoked, must not abandon the columbarium.

If the Director or an authorized officer suspects that a columbarium in respect of which a specified instrument is in force, has expired without being renewed or extended, or is revoked, is not in operation, the Director or authorized officer may give a notice about the suspected abandonment (notice about suspected abandonment).
For the purposes of subsection (2), the notice about suspected abandonment must be given to the instrument holder.

subsection.leadIn: The notice about suspected abandonment must warn that, unless within 2 months after the date of the notice, the instrument holder gives a specified response—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the instrument holder is liable to be prosecuted for an offence under section 74; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a specified officer may apply for an occupation order under section 76 to enable the officer to carry out the steps that the officer considers necessary for disposal of ashes in respect of the columbarium.

subsection.content: If the instrument holder fails to give a specified response within 1 month after the date of the notice about suspected abandonment, the Director or an authorized officer may give a reminder notice.

subsection.leadIn: The reminder notice must warn again that, unless within 2 months after the date of the notice about suspected abandonment, the instrument holder gives a specified response—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the instrument holder is liable to be prosecuted for an offence under section 74; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a specified officer may apply for an occupation order under section 76 to enable the officer to carry out the steps that the officer considers necessary for disposal of ashes in respect of the columbarium.

subsection.leadIn: The reminder notice under subsection (5) must be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: given to the instrument holder;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: published in the Gazette; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: posted at a conspicuous place outside the columbarium.

subsection.leadIn: An instrument holder abandons the columbarium if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the notice about suspected abandonment has been given; but

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the instrument holder fails to give a specified response within 2 months after the date of the notice about suspected abandonment.

subsection.content: A person who, without lawful authority or reasonable excuse, removes or defaces the reminder notice posted under subsection (7)(c) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: specified response (指明回應) has the meaning given by section 71.

section.name: s71
section.heading: Meaning of specified response
section.leadIn: A person gives a specified response for the purposes of section 69 or 70 if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the person has been issued with a specified instrument in respect of the columbarium but it has expired without having been renewed or extended—the person applies for the renewal or extension of the instrument;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the person’s specified instrument is in force in respect of the columbarium—the person informs the Director or authorized officer, in writing, that the person continues to operate the columbarium; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the person gives to the Director or authorized officer a written undertaking to carry out the prescribed ash disposal procedures in respect of the columbarium, specifying the particulars that the Director or authorized officer requires.

section.name: s72
section.heading: Columbarium to continue operation if specified response given
section.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a notice about suspected abandonment has been given under section 70 in respect of a columbarium; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person whose specified instrument in respect of the columbarium is in force has given a specified response within the meaning of section 71(b),

section.continued: the person must continue to operate the columbarium.

section.name: s73
section.heading: Breach of undertaking to carry out prescribed ash disposal procedures

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a notice about suspected abandonment has been given under section 69 or 70; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person has given a specified response within the meaning of section 71(c) by giving an undertaking to carry out the prescribed ash disposal procedures,

subsection.continued: the person must comply with the undertaking, whether or not the person has ever operated, kept, managed or in any other way had control of the columbarium.

subsection.leadIn: A person referred to in subsection (1)(b) fails to comply with the undertaking referred to in that subsection if the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: fails to give a commencement of ash disposal notice in accordance with section 8 of Schedule 5 within 30 days after the date on which the undertaking is given; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: fails to take a step specified in a commencement of ash disposal notice at the time specified in that notice for taking that step and in accordance with Part 2 of that Schedule.

section.name: s74
section.heading: Offence for contravention of section 68, 69(1), 70(1), 72 or 73
section.leadIn: A person who contravenes section 68, 69(1), 70(1), 72 or 73 commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine of $2,000,000 and to imprisonment for 3 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $5,000,000 and to imprisonment for 7 years.

section.name: s75
section.heading: Obligations of owner, mortgagee, etc. taking possession of columbarium premises

subsection.content: A person (person in possession) who, whether or not as owner or mortgagee or based on any other interest in any premises that are a columbarium (but excluding the Government), takes possession of those premises does not commit an offence under section 11 merely by taking possession if the person notifies the Director, in writing, of that fact within 7 days after the date of taking possession.
The person in possession must carry out the prescribed ash disposal procedures as soon as reasonably practicable after taking possession of the premises.

subsection.leadIn: A person in possession is regarded as having contravened subsection (2) if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person is an owner or mortgagee who acquired an interest in the premises subject to the obligation to carry out the prescribed ash disposal procedures; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the person fails to—

subparagraph.content: give a commencement of ash disposal notice in accordance with section 8 of Schedule 5 within 30 days after the date of the notification under subsection (1); or

subparagraph.leadIn: take a step specified in the commencement of ash disposal notice—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: at the time specified in that notice for taking that step; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: in accordance with Part 2 of that Schedule.

subsection.leadIn: Despite subsection (2), a person in possession who is not a person referred to in subsection (3)(a) may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: invite, in writing, the Director to carry out the steps that the Director considers necessary for disposal of ashes in respect of the columbarium on-site; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: allow a specified officer to enter the columbarium premises for the purposes of carrying out those steps,

subsection.leadIn: A person in possession who is not a person referred to in subsection (3)(a) is regarded as having contravened subsection (2) if the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: fails to—

subparagraph.content: give a commencement of ash disposal notice in accordance with section 8 of Schedule 5 within 30 days after the date of the notification under subsection (1); or

subparagraph.leadIn: take a step specified in the commencement of ash disposal notice—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: at the time specified in that notice for taking that step; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: in accordance with Part 2 of that Schedule; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: fails to act in accordance with subsection (4).

subsection.content: If a person in possession who is a person referred to in subsection (3)(a) contravenes subsection (2), that person commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine of $500,000.
If a person in possession who is not a person referred to in subsection (3)(a) contravenes subsection (2), that person commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine of $250,000.

subsection.leadIn: Despite subsection (2), if an application for transfer under section 39 is received by the Licensing Board, a person in possession is not required, with the written permission of the Director, to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: act in accordance with that subsection; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: so act until after the period specified by the Director.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (3)(a), a person in possession acquired an interest in the premises subject to the obligation to carry out the prescribed ash disposal procedures if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: at the time of acquisition—

subparagraph.content: a certificate of columbarium use was registered under section 46 against the premises; and
no certificate was registered under section 80 against the premises; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person in possession is a successor or assign of another person who acquired the interest in the premises in circumstances specified in paragraph (a).

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (9)(a), the time of acquisition of an interest in the premises is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the person in possession is an owner—the time of acquiring the ownership of the premises by the person; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the person in possession is a mortgagee—the time of executing the mortgage deed by the person.

subsection.content: A person in possession may request a person who has operated, kept, managed or in any other way had control of the columbarium to produce any information (including any book, document, article, thing, record and register) that the person in possession reasonably considers necessary to facilitate the carrying out of the prescribed ash disposal procedures by the person in possession, and that person is required to produce the information to the person in possession.

subsection.leadIn: This section does not affect a right that the person in possession may have, as owner or mortgagee or based on any other interest in the premises, to claim compensation against another person for—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: that other person’s failure to deliver vacant possession in accordance with the terms of the instrument—

subparagraph.content: entered into by the person in possession in the capacity as owner or mortgagee in respect of the premises with that other person; or
by virtue of which the interest of the person in possession in the premises arises; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that other person’s other violation of the interest of the person in possession.

section.name: s76
section.heading: Power to carry out steps necessary for disposal of ashes; occupation order

subsection.content: A specified officer may carry out any steps that the officer considers necessary for disposal of ashes in respect of a columbarium if the prescribed ash disposal procedures have, or any step in them has, not been carried out in respect of the columbarium.

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting subsection (1), a magistrate may, on an application by a specified officer and on being satisfied that section 68, 69(1), 70(1), 72, 73 or 75(2) has been contravened in respect of a columbarium, make an order (occupation order) empowering the specified officer—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to enter the columbarium premises;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to occupy the columbarium premises, or any part of them, for a period specified in the order; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to carry out the steps that the officer considers necessary for disposal of ashes in respect of the columbarium.

subsection.leadIn: An occupation order may be made, whether or not a person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is identified as having contravened section 68, 69(1), 70(1), 72, 73 or 75(2); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is prosecuted for an offence under section 74 or 75(6) or (7).

subsection.content: This section does not affect any person’s liability for failing to carry out the prescribed ash disposal procedures as required by section 68(2)(b), 73 or 75(2).

subsection.leadIn: If a specified officer reasonably believes that a person has any information that the officer considers necessary to facilitate disposal of ashes by the officer under this Ordinance—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the officer may request that person to produce the information to him or her; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that person is required to produce the information to the officer.

subsection.leadIn: A specified officer may, for the purpose of disposal of ashes under this Ordinance, consider and use any information—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: produced under subsection (5);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: obtained during an inspection or search under this Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: obtained by the exercise of the powers under an occupation order.

subsection.leadIn: In subsections (5) and (6)—
subsection.def: information (資料) includes any book, document, article, thing, record and register.

subsection.content: Part 1 of Schedule 5 (which provides for the making of an occupation order and the effect of such an order) has effect.

section.name: s77
section.heading: Power of court to order return of ashes

subsection.content: The court may, on application, make an order for the return of ashes as provided in section 11 of Schedule 5.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: court (法院) means the District Court.

section.name: s78
section.heading: Further provisions on ash disposal procedures
section.content: Part 2 of Schedule 5 (which contains further provisions on ash disposal procedures and the recovery of expenses incurred in connection with the procedures) has effect.

section.name: s79
section.heading: Discharge of obligations in respect of disposal of ashes

subsection.content: Subject to section 81, a person to whom an ash disposal requirement applies in respect of a columbarium is discharged from all obligations in respect of the disposal of ashes interred in the columbarium if the person complies with the requirement.

subsection.leadIn: In subsection (1)—
subsection.def: ash disposal requirement (骨灰處置規定) means the requirement under section 68(2)(b), 73 or 75(2) to carry out the prescribed ash disposal procedures.

section.name: s80
section.heading: Certificate of cessation of columbarium use

subsection.leadIn: The Licensing Board may, on application and if satisfied that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the prescribed ash disposal procedures have been carried out in respect of a columbarium against the premises of which a certificate of columbarium use is registered under section 46; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the steps that a specified officer considers necessary for disposal of ashes in respect of such a columbarium under this Ordinance have been carried out by the officer,

subsection.continued: issue a certificate that the premises cease to be a columbarium.

subsection.leadIn: An application for the purposes of subsection (1) must be made by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the owner of the premises;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the holder of a specified instrument in respect of the premises;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the person in possession within the meaning of section 75; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a specified officer.

subsection.content: A person to whom a certificate is issued under subsection (1) in respect of any premises may register the certificate against the premises in the Land Registry.

subsection.leadIn: On determining an application for the purposes of subsection (1), the Licensing Board must notify the applicant in writing of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Licensing Board’s decision; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the application is refused—the reasons for the refusal.

section.name: s81
section.heading: Contractual obligations not affected
section.content: Neither this Part nor Schedule 5 affects any claim for compensation arising out of an agreement for the sale of an interment right in respect of a columbarium for a breach of the seller’s obligation in connection with the handling of ashes.

section.name: s82
section.heading: Interpretation of Part 8
section.leadIn: In this Part—
section.def: appeal (上訴) means an appeal under section 84;
appellant (上訴人) means a person lodging an appeal;
Chairperson (主席) means the Chairperson of the Appeal Board appointed under section 83(3);
Deputy Chairperson (副主席) means a Deputy Chairperson of the Appeal Board appointed under section 83(3);
legally qualified (具所需法律資格) means qualified for appointment as a District Judge under section 5 of the District Court Ordinance (Cap. 336);
panel member (委員團成員) means a member of the panel of persons appointed under section 83(2);

party (方)—(a)in relation to an appeal against a decision of the Licensing Board—means the appellant or the Licensing Board;(b)in relation to an appeal against a decision of the Director—means the appellant or the Director;
presiding officer (審裁官), in relation to an appeal, means the presiding officer referred to in section 85(1)(a).

section.name: s83
section.heading: Establishment of Appeal Board

subsection.content: A body is established with the name “Private Columbaria Appeal Board” in English and “私營骨灰安置所上訴委員會” in Chinese.

subsection.leadIn: The Chief Executive may appoint a panel of persons each of whom—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is neither a member of the Licensing Board nor a public officer; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is considered by the Chief Executive to be suitable to serve on an Appeal Board to hear an appeal.

subsection.leadIn: The Chief Executive may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: appoint a panel member who is legally qualified to be the Chairperson of the Appeal Board; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: appoint other panel members who are legally qualified to be Deputy Chairpersons of the Appeal Board.

subsection.leadIn: A panel member—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is to hold and vacate office in accordance with the panel member’s terms of appointment; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on ceasing to be a panel member, is eligible for reappointment.

subsection.content: An appointment under this section must be notified in the Gazette.
The Secretary may appoint a public officer to be the secretary to the Appeal Board.
The Secretary may appoint a legal adviser to advise the Appeal Board on legal matters relating to an appeal.

section.name: s84
section.heading: Appeals

subsection.leadIn: An applicant or a holder of a specified instrument who is aggrieved by any of the following decisions under this Ordinance may appeal to the Appeal Board—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a refusal under section 18 (whether or not as modified under section 19) or section 20, 20A or 21 of an application for the issue of a specified instrument; (Amended 18 of 2025 s. 11)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a refusal under section 40(1)(c)—

subparagraph.content: to renew a licence or exemption; or
to extend a temporary suspension of liability;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: a refusal under section 39(4) of an application for—

subparagraph.content: the transfer of a licence or exemption; or

subparagraph.leadIn: the transfer of a temporary suspension of liability together with one or both of the following—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the related application for the issue of a licence;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: the related application for the issue of an exemption;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a decision under section 40(1)(a)(i) or (b) to revoke or suspend a specified instrument;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: a decision under section 40(1)(a)(ii) to revoke or suspend an authorization under a licence;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: a refusal of an application for permission for the purposes of section 53(1);

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.leadIn: a decision under section 39(6) or 40(1)(d)—

subparagraph.content: to vary the conditions to which a specified instrument is subject; or
to impose new conditions;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: a refusal of an application made under section 41 to vary the conditions to which a specified instrument is subject;
a decision under section 42(1) to vary a particular or matter;

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: a refusal of an application made under section 43(1)(a) for the suspension of the operation of a decision under section 40(1) pending the determination of an appeal;

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.content: a decision under section 64 to serve an enforcement notice;
a refusal of an application for the issue of a certificate under section 80;

paragraph.name: m
paragraph.content: a refusal of an application made under section 18(2) of Schedule 5 for the approval of an ash disposal plan.

subsection.content: A person who wishes to appeal under subsection (1) must lodge a notice of appeal, in writing and in the specified form, with the Appeal Board within 21 days after the date on which the notice of the decision under appeal is given to the person.

subsection.leadIn: The notice of appeal must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: set out the grounds of the appeal and the facts on which the appeal relies;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be accompanied by a copy of every document that the appellant intends to rely on; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: include particulars of every witness whom the appellant intends to call at the hearing.

subsection.leadIn: The secretary to the Appeal Board must, as soon as practicable, give a copy of the notice of appeal—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if subsection (1)(a), (b), (c), (d), (e), (f), (g), (h), (i), (j) or (l) applies—to the Licensing Board; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if subsection (1)(k) or (m) applies—to the Director.

section.name: s85
section.heading: Composition of Appeal Board for purposes of appeal

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of an appeal, the Appeal Board consists of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a presiding officer, who is to preside at the hearing of the appeal; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: 4 panel members selected by the presiding officer.

subsection.content: Subject to subsections (3), (4) and (5), the Chairperson or a Deputy Chairperson may act as presiding officer.
The Chairperson must not act as presiding officer if the Chairperson has a direct or indirect interest in the appeal.
A Deputy Chairperson must not act as presiding officer if the Deputy Chairperson has a direct or indirect interest in the appeal.

If the Chairperson and each Deputy Chairperson have a direct or indirect interest in an appeal, the Secretary may select a panel member who is legally qualified, and who does not have a direct or indirect interest in the appeal, to act as presiding officer.
The presiding officer must not select a panel member to hear an appeal if the panel member has a direct or indirect interest in the appeal.

If the term of appointment of the Chairperson or a Deputy Chairperson, or a panel member selected under subsection (5), who is the presiding officer at an appeal or a panel member selected under subsection (1)(b) for the purposes of an appeal expires during the hearing of the appeal, the Chairperson, Deputy Chairperson or panel member may continue to hear the appeal until the appeal is determined.

section.name: s86
section.heading: Hearing and determination of appeals
