subsection.content: The presiding officer and 4 other panel members constituting the Appeal Board for hearing an appeal are to be present to hear and determine the appeal.

However, if after the commencement of the hearing of an appeal, one or more panel members (other than the presiding officer) are unable to continue hearing the appeal, the remaining panel members (so long as their number, including the presiding officer, is not less than 3) may, with the consent of the parties, continue to hear and determine the appeal.

subsection.leadIn: Each party to an appeal may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: appear and be present at the hearing of the appeal; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: make representations during the hearing or be represented by another person, authorized by the party, in writing, during the hearing.

subsection.leadIn: If a party to an appeal fails to appear on a date set for the hearing of an appeal without showing reasonable cause for the failure, an Appeal Board may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: proceed to hear any other party entitled to appear; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: make its decision without hearing the absent party.

subsection.content: A legal adviser may be present at any hearing before the Appeal Board or deliberations of the Appeal Board to advise the Appeal Board on legal matters.
When the legal adviser advises the Appeal Board on legal matters relating to an appeal, the legal adviser must do so in the presence of every party to the appeal (or the party’s representative).

However, if the advice is tendered after the Appeal Board has commenced to deliberate on its findings, every such party or representative must be informed afterwards of the advice that the legal adviser has tendered.

In any case where the Appeal Board does not accept the advice of the legal adviser on a legal matter relating to an appeal, every party to the appeal (or the party’s representative) must be informed of this fact.

subsection.leadIn: Except for a question of law—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: every question before the Appeal Board is to be determined by a majority of the members hearing the appeal; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if there is an equality of votes in respect of a question to be determined in an appeal, the presiding officer of the Appeal Board hearing the appeal is to have a casting vote in addition to the presiding officer’s original vote.

subsection.content: A question of law to be determined in an appeal is to be determined by the presiding officer of the Appeal Board hearing the appeal.

subsection.leadIn: In determining an appeal, an Appeal Board may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: confirm, reverse or vary the decision appealed against;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: substitute its own decision for the decision appealed against; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: make any other order that it thinks fit.

subsection.content: The decision of an Appeal Board on any appeal is final.

subsection.leadIn: The Appeal Board must notify the parties to an appeal in writing of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Appeal Board’s decision;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the reasons for the decision; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the date on which the decision is to take effect.

subsection.content: The secretary to the Appeal Board is to serve a copy of the written notification under subsection (13) on the parties to the appeal.

section.name: s87
section.heading: Powers of Appeal Board

subsection.leadIn: Subject to sections 88 and 92, in the hearing of an appeal, the Appeal Board may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: subject to subsections (2) and (2A), receive and consider any material— (Amended 18 of 2025 s. 16)

subparagraph.content: whether by way of oral evidence, written statements, documents or otherwise; and
whether or not it would be admissible in a court;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: by notice in writing, summon a person—

subparagraph.content: to produce to the Appeal Board any document (including material and information referred to in section 94) that is relevant to the appeal and is in or under the custody or control of the person; or
to appear before the Appeal Board and to give evidence relevant to the appeal;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: administer oaths and affirmations;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: require evidence to be given on oath or affirmation; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: make an order prohibiting a person from publishing or otherwise disclosing any material the Appeal Board receives.

subsection.content: Subsection (1)(a) does not entitle a person to require the Appeal Board to receive and consider any material that had not been made available to the Licensing Board at any time before the decision under appeal was made.

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.content: Despite subsection (2), the Appeal Board may, upon special grounds being shown, receive and consider any material that had not been made available to the Licensing Board before the decision under appeal was made. (Added 18 of 2025 s. 16)

subsection.name: 2B
subsection.leadIn: However, to avoid doubt, the power under subsection (2A) is not exercisable in an appeal if—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the notice of appeal is lodged within that period. (Added 18 of 2025 s. 16)

subsection.content: Any notice or order of an Appeal Board hearing an appeal is to be issued by the presiding officer of the Appeal Board.

section.name: s88
section.heading: Privileges against disclosure
section.content: In relation to an appeal, the appellant, the Licensing Board, the Director and any other person summoned under section 87(1)(b) are each to have the same privileges in respect of the disclosure of any material as if the proceedings before the Appeal Board were proceedings before a court.

section.name: s89
section.heading: Case may be stated for Court of Appeal

subsection.content: The Appeal Board may, before determining an appeal, refer a question of law arising in the appeal to the Court of Appeal for determination by way of case stated.
On hearing the case, the Court of Appeal may amend the case or order it to be sent back to the Appeal Board for amendment in a manner that the Court of Appeal orders.
The Appeal Board is to comply with the order.

section.name: s90
section.heading: Offences relating to appeals

subsection.leadIn: In relation to an appeal, a person commits an offence if the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: without reasonable excuse, refuses or fails—

subparagraph.content: to attend and give evidence when required to do so by the Appeal Board;
to answer truthfully and completely questions put to the person by the Appeal Board;
to produce a document that the person is required by the Appeal Board to produce; or
to comply with any other lawful order, requirement or direction made or given by the Appeal Board or the presiding officer of the Appeal Board; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: disturbs or otherwise interferes with the proceedings of the Appeal Board.

subsection.content: A person commits an offence if the person publishes or otherwise discloses any material in contravention of an order under section 87(1)(e).
A person who commits an offence under subsection (1) or (2) is liable on conviction to a fine at level 5.

It is a defence to a charge for an offence under subsection (2) for the person charged to prove that the person did not know, and had no reason for knowing, that the Appeal Board had made an order under section 87(1)(e) prohibiting the publication or other disclosure of the material concerned.

subsection.leadIn: A person charged with an offence under subsection (2) is to be taken to have established a fact that needs to be established for the purpose of a defence under subsection (4) if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: there is sufficient evidence to raise an issue as to that alleged fact; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the contrary is not proved by the prosecution beyond reasonable doubt.

section.name: s91
section.heading: Chairperson of Appeal Board may make rules and determine practice or procedure

subsection.leadIn: The Chairperson may make rules—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to provide for the lodging of appeals; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: generally for regulating the practice and procedure of the Appeal Board.

subsection.content: Rules made under this section are not subsidiary legislation.

The Chairperson may determine any matter of practice or procedure relating to the hearing of appeals if no provision governing the matter is made in this Ordinance or in rules made under subsection (1).

section.name: s92
section.heading: Privileges and immunities of Appeal Board members and witnesses

subsection.content: The Chairperson, a Deputy Chairperson or a panel member performing any functions under this Ordinance is to have the same privileges and immunities as a judge of the Court of First Instance in civil proceedings in that court.
A witness appearing before the Appeal Board is to have the same privileges and immunities of a witness in civil proceedings in the Court of First Instance.

section.name: s93
section.heading: Delegation and authorization

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), the Director may, in writing, delegate to a public officer any of his or her functions or powers under this Ordinance.
The power to delegate conferred by subsection (1) may not be delegated by the Director.
The Director may appoint in writing a public officer as an authorized officer for the purposes of this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: When exercising a power or performing a function under this Ordinance, an officer delegated under subsection (1) or an authorized officer—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may be assisted by such persons as the officer reasonably requires; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must produce the officer’s written delegation or appointment for inspection by any person who reasonably requires to see it.

section.name: s94
section.heading: Consultation with other authorities and persons

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: specified person (指明人士) means—(a)the Licensing Board; or(b)the Director.

subsection.leadIn: If a columbarium’s compliance with another Ordinance is relevant for the purpose of a specified person’s performance of a function under this Ordinance and a person (other authority) is conferred with the function to enforce that other Ordinance—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the specified person may consult the other authority and may, for this purpose, present to the other authority any statement, photographs, records (including plans) and other material prepared, taken, made or obtained under the notification scheme referred to in section 28;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the other authority may present information that it has in connection with the enforcement of that other Ordinance to the specified person; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the specified person may, when performing the function under this Ordinance, consider and use the information including producing the information before the Appeal Board hearing an appeal under Part 8.

subsection.content: A specified person may consult any other authority or any other person if the expertise of the authority or person is necessary for or relevant to the performance of a function under this Ordinance.

section.name: s95
section.heading: Guidelines

subsection.leadIn: The Licensing Board may issue guidelines—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: indicating the manner in which it proposes to perform its functions under this Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: providing guidance on the operation of any provision of this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting subsection (1), the Licensing Board may issue guidelines—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: indicating the considerations it proposes to take into account in making a decision under this Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: providing guidance on compliance with a provision of this Ordinance.

subsection.content: The guidelines are not subsidiary legislation.

section.name: s96
section.heading: Codes of practice

subsection.content: For providing practical guidance in respect of this Ordinance or conditions imposed under it, the Licensing Board may issue a code of practice setting out principles, procedures, guidelines, standards or requirements in relation to columbaria.

A failure on the part of any person to observe a code of practice issued under subsection (1) does not of itself render that person liable to criminal proceedings of any kind. However, in any civil or criminal proceedings (including proceedings for an offence under this Ordinance), evidence about the failure may be relied on as tending to establish or to negative any liability that is in question in those proceedings.
A code of practice is not subsidiary legislation.

section.name: s97
section.heading: Management plan

subsection.content: The Licensing Board may require a management plan, submitted for approval for the purposes of section 18(2) in respect of a columbarium, to cover matters that the Licensing Board specifies.

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting subsection (1), the Licensing Board may require the management plan to cover in respect of the columbarium concerned—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the holding capacity for visitors and admission control;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the traffic and public transport arrangement or management;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: crowd management;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: security management;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: manpower deployment on peak grave sweeping days or periods and other days or periods;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: a contingency plan in the event of fire or other emergency situations; and

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: measures to ensure compliance with guidelines and codes of practice issued under sections 95 and 96.

section.name: s98
section.heading: Qualified professional

subsection.leadIn: The Licensing Board may by notice in writing specify, either generally or in a particular case or class of cases, either or both of the following to be a qualified professional for the purposes of giving certification, or doing any other thing, as required by a provision of this Ordinance—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an authorized person;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a registered structural engineer.

subsection.content: The notice is not subsidiary legislation.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: authorized person (認可人士) and registered structural engineer (註冊結構工程師) have the meanings given by section 2(1) of the Buildings Ordinance (Cap. 123).

section.name: s99
section.heading: Offence of providing false or misleading information

subsection.leadIn: A person commits an offence if the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: provides information that is false or misleading in a material particular in, or in connection with, an application the person makes under this Ordinance in respect of a columbarium; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: furnishes the Director, an authorized officer or a public officer with information under this Ordinance knowing that it is false or misleading in a material particular.

subsection.content: A person who commits an offence under subsection (1) is liable on conviction to a fine of $500,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years.

section.name: s99A
section.heading: Offence relating to sale of interment rights without authorization or when authorization has been revoked or suspended
section.leadIn: The holder of a licence in respect of a columbarium who sells any interment right in respect of the columbarium without an authorization under the licence to sell the interment rights, or when the authorization has been revoked or suspended under section 40(1)(a)(ii), commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine of $2,000,000 and to imprisonment for 6 months; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $5,000,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years.

section.name: s100
section.heading: Liability of directors, partners, etc. for offences

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a body corporate commits an offence under this Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it is proved that the offence has been committed with the consent or connivance of, or is attributable to any neglect on the part of, any director, manager, company secretary or other similar officer of the body corporate,

subsection.continued: the director, manager, company secretary or other similar officer commits the like offence. (Amended 18 of 2025 s. 20)

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a partner in a partnership commits an offence under this Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it is proved that the offence has been committed with the consent or connivance of, or is attributable to any neglect on the part of, any other partner in the partnership or any other person concerned in the management of the partnership,

subsection.continued: the other partner or the other person concerned in the management of the partnership commits the like offence.

subsection.content: If the affairs of a body corporate are managed by its members, subsection (1) applies in relation to the acts and defaults of a member in connection with the member’s functions of management as if the member were a director of the body corporate.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a member of an unincorporated body commits an offence under this Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it is proved that the offence has been committed with the consent or connivance of, or is attributable to any neglect on the part of, any other member or any manager, secretary or other similar officer of the unincorporated body,

subsection.continued: the other member or the manager, secretary or other similar officer commits the like offence.

section.name: s101
section.heading: Time limit for prosecution
section.content: Despite section 26 of the Magistrates Ordinance (Cap. 227), proceedings may be instituted for an offence, other than an indictable offence, under this Ordinance within 12 months after the offence is discovered by, or comes to the notice of, the Licensing Board or the Director.

section.name: s102
section.heading: Fees

subsection.content: The fee for an item specified in column 2 of Schedule 6 is payable at the time specified in column 3 of that Schedule in the amount specified in column 4 of that Schedule opposite to that item.
A fee paid under this section is not refundable.

section.name: s103
section.heading: Amendment of Schedules

subsection.content: The Licensing Board may, with the approval of the Secretary, by notice published in the Gazette, amend Schedule 3 or 4 or Part 2 of Schedule 5.
The Secretary may, by notice published in the Gazette, amend Schedule 1, 6 or 7.

section.name: s104
section.heading: Regulations

subsection.leadIn: The Secretary may make regulations—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: providing for any matter required or permitted to be prescribed under this Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: providing for matters that are necessary or expedient to give effect to the provisions of this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting subsection (1), the Secretary may make regulations—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: providing for principles, procedures, guidelines, standards or requirements about the operation and management of a columbarium, including additional duties required of an applicant for or holder of a specified instrument;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: restricting any subletting or assignment of the columbarium premises, or any part of them, in a manner that is inconsistent with the operation of a columbarium;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: requiring that the requirements for enforceability of an agreement for the sale of an interment right under section 49 be met in respect of each agreement for the sale of an interment right in respect of the columbarium;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: restricting the imposition of any additional fees, charges or other sums in respect of an interment right beyond the amounts, or not in accordance with any mechanism for their future revision, specified or otherwise contained in any agreement for the sale of the interment right entered into before the cut-off time;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: providing for measures relating to building safety, fire safety, other safety matters, drainage and sewage, including requiring certificates or reports, by a qualified professional, to be submitted to the Licensing Board at regular intervals;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: providing for measures for minimizing the environmental nuisance caused to the neighbourhood by the operation of a columbarium; or

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: providing for any principles, procedures, guidelines, standards or requirements relevant to any provisions of this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: Regulations made under this Ordinance may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be of general application or make different provisions for different cases or classes of cases; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: contain any incidental, consequential, evidential, transitional, saving or supplementary provisions that the Secretary thinks fit.

subsection.content: Regulations under this section may provide that a contravention of a regulation is an offence and may prescribe penalties for it of a fine not exceeding level 6 and imprisonment not exceeding 2 years.

section.name: s105
section.heading: Licensing Board not servant or agent of Government
section.content: The Licensing Board is not a servant or agent of the Government and does not enjoy any status, immunity or privilege of the Government.

section.name: s106
section.heading: Immunity from civil liability

subsection.leadIn: A person to whom this subsection applies is not civilly liable for an act done or omitted to be done by the person in good faith—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in performing or purportedly performing a function of the person under this Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in exercising or purportedly exercising a power of the person under this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) applies to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a member of the Licensing Board;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a member of a committee of the Licensing Board;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a member of the staff of the Licensing Board; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the Director, an authorized officer or any other public officer.

subsection.content: In relation to a person referred to in subsection (2)(d), an act referred to in subsection (1) includes taking possession of, breaking open, seizing, removing, impounding or disposing of property.
Subsection (1) does not in any way affect any liability of the Government in respect of an act or omission of a public officer.

section.name: s107
section.heading: Service of documents, etc.

subsection.leadIn: A notice, decision or other document required to be given, issued, notified or served on a person (other than the Appeal Board, the Licensing Board or a public officer) under this Ordinance may be given, issued, notified or served—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of a natural person—

subparagraph.content: by delivering it by hand to the person;

subparagraph.leadIn: by sending it by post in a letter—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: addressed to the person at the person’s usual place of residence or business or (if that place is unknown) at the person’s last known place of residence or business; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: if the person dies—addressed to the person’s last known place of residence or business;
by sending it by fax transmission to the fax number of the person or (if that number is unknown) to the last known fax number of the person; or
by sending it by electronic mail transmission to the electronic mail address of the person or (if that address is unknown) to the last known electronic mail address of the person;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of a partner in a partnership—

subparagraph.content: by delivering it by hand to the partner authorized in writing to act for and on behalf of the partnership;

subparagraph.leadIn: by sending it by post in a letter—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: addressed to the partner authorized in writing to act for and on behalf of the partnership at that partner’s usual place of residence or business or (if that place is unknown) at that partner’s last known place of residence or business; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: if that partner dies—addressed to that partner’s last known place of residence or business, and to the usual places of residence or business of the other partners in the partnership or (if those places are unknown) to the last known places of residence or business of those other partners;

by sending it by fax transmission to the fax number of the partner authorized in writing to act for and on behalf of the partnership or (if that number is unknown) to the last known fax number of that partner; or

by sending it by electronic mail transmission to the electronic mail address of the partner authorized in writing to act for and on behalf of the partnership or (if that address is unknown) to the last known electronic mail address of that partner; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of a body corporate—

subparagraph.content: by delivering it by hand to any place in Hong Kong at which the body corporate carries on business and giving it to any person in the place who appears to be concerned in the management of, or employed by, the body corporate;

by sending it by post in a letter addressed to the body corporate at its registered office in Hong Kong or at any place in Hong Kong at which the body corporate carries on business or (if that office or place is unknown) at the body corporate’s last known place of business;
by sending it by fax transmission to the fax number of the body corporate or (if that number is unknown) to the last known fax number of the body corporate; or
by sending it by electronic mail transmission to the electronic mail address of the body corporate or (if that address is unknown) to the last known electronic mail address of the body corporate.

subsection.leadIn: A notice, decision or other document given, issued, notified or served in accordance with subsection (1) is to be taken, in the absence of evidence to the contrary, to have been given, issued, notified or served—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if delivered by hand—on the day after the day on which it was so delivered;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if sent by post—on the second working day after the day on which it was posted;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if sent by fax transmission—on the day after the day on which it was transmitted; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: if sent by electronic mail transmission—on the day after the day on which it was transmitted.

subsection.leadIn: A notice or other document required to be given to, lodged with or served on the Appeal Board, the Licensing Board or a public officer under this Ordinance may be given, lodged or served—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by delivering it by hand to the office of the Appeal Board, the Licensing Board or the officer (as the case requires) during office hours;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by sending it by post to the office of the Appeal Board, the Licensing Board or the officer (as the case requires);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: by sending it by fax transmission to the fax number of the Appeal Board, the Licensing Board or the officer (as the case requires); or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: by sending it by electronic mail transmission to the electronic mail address of the Appeal Board, the Licensing Board or the officer (as the case requires).

subsection.leadIn: A notice or other document given, lodged or served in accordance with subsection (3) is to be taken, in the absence of evidence to the contrary, to have been given, lodged or served—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if delivered by hand—on the day after the day on which it was so delivered;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if sent by post—on the second working day after the day on which it was posted;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if sent by fax transmission—on the day after the day on which it was transmitted; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: if sent by electronic mail transmission—on the day after the day on which it was transmitted.

subsection.content: This section is subject to section 2 of, and item 73 of Schedule 1 to, the Electronic Transactions (Exclusion) Order (Cap. 553 sub. leg. B).

section.name: s108
section.heading: Transitionals
section.content: The transitional provisions as set out in Schedule 7 have effect.

part.name: P10
part.heading: Implications on Land (Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance, Town Planning Ordinance, Buildings Ordinance and other Ordinances

section.name: s109
section.heading: Other Ordinances, law and liabilities not affected, unless expressly provided otherwise

subsection.content: Subsections (2), (3) and (4) apply, except as expressly provided to the contrary in this Part.
The requirements under this Ordinance are in addition to and do not derogate from any requirement under any other Ordinance or law.

subsection.leadIn: A specified instrument—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has effect solely for the purposes of this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: does not, to any extent, negate liability of any description for any contravention of any other Ordinance or law; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: does not, to any extent, negate liability of any description arising—

subparagraph.content: under an instrument affecting land, whether or not the Government is a party to the instrument;
from an agreement, whether or not the Government is a party to the agreement;
in tort, whether or not the tort is committed against the Government; or
in any other manner.

subsection.content: That any function is conferred on or performed by a person under this Ordinance does not, to any extent, affect any function conferred on or performed by a person under any other Ordinance or law.

section.name: s110
section.heading: Effect of Land (Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance modified

subsection.leadIn: Section 6(1), (2) and (3) of the Land (Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 28) does not apply in respect of the unlawful occupation of unleased land during a period if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the occupation is necessary for, or ancillary to, the operation of a pre-cut-off columbarium; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: during the period—

subparagraph.content: the instrument-related condition is met in the manner specified in subsection (2), (3) or (5); and
the extent of breach condition specified in subsection (6) is met.

subsection.content: The instrument-related condition is met if a temporary suspension of liability is in force in respect of the pre-cut-off columbarium.

subsection.leadIn: The instrument-related condition is met if an application for the issue of a temporary suspension of liability in respect of the pre-cut-off columbarium—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has been made but has not been determined;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has been refused, and the period within which a notice of appeal may be lodged against the refusal has not yet expired; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: has been refused, which refusal has been appealed against but the appeal has not yet been determined.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (3) does not apply if, in respect of an application referred to in that subsection, the occupation of land as is necessary for, or ancillary to, the operation of the pre-cut-off columbarium (to the extent as shown in the plans required under section 25) includes unlawful occupation of unleased land but the applicant—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: does not apply to the Director of Lands for lawful authority to occupy the unleased land; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: does not provide a written declaration to the Director of Lands that the applicant has no claim to the unleased land, whether based on possession of the unleased land before, on or after the date of application or on any other ground.

subsection.leadIn: The instrument-related condition is met if an application for the extension of a temporary suspension of liability in respect of the pre-cut-off columbarium—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has been made but has not been determined;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has been refused, and the period within which a notice of appeal may be lodged against the refusal has not yet expired; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: has been refused, which refusal has been appealed against and is suspended from operation under section 43 pending the determination of the appeal.

subsection.leadIn: The extent of breach condition is that any unlawful occupation of unleased land as is necessary for, or ancillary to, the operation of the pre-cut-off columbarium is limited to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if a temporary suspension of liability is issued or extended in respect of the columbarium—the extent of unlawful occupation of unleased land as is necessary for, or ancillary to, the operation of the columbarium, as shown in the approved plans annexed to the temporary suspension of liability; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in any other case—the extent of unlawful occupation of unleased land as was necessary for, or ancillary to, the operation of the columbarium as at the cut-off time.

subsection.content: This section does not affect any civil liability in respect of the unlawful occupation of unleased land.
Subsection (7) does not affect the operation of section 109.

In subsection (1), a reference to section 6(3) of the Land (Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 28) is to be construed as a reference to section 6(3) of that Ordinance to the extent that it relates to section 6(2)(b) (but not section 6(2A)(iii)) of that Ordinance.

section.name: s111
section.heading: Effect of Town Planning Ordinance modified

subsection.leadIn: Sections 20(8), 21(2), 21F(2) and 23(1) and (2) of the Town Planning Ordinance (Cap. 131) do not apply in respect of an unauthorized development undertaken or continued on any land during a period if— (Amended 25 of 2023 s. 128)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the development is necessary for, or ancillary to, the operation of a pre-cut-off columbarium; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the condition specified in subsection (2), (3) or (5) is met during the period.

subsection.leadIn: The condition is that either of the following instruments is in force in respect of the pre-cut-off columbarium—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an exemption;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a temporary suspension of liability.

subsection.leadIn: The condition is that an application for the issue of an exemption, or the issue of a temporary suspension of liability, in respect of the pre-cut-off columbarium—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has been made but has not been determined;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has been refused, and the period within which a notice of appeal may be lodged against the refusal has not yet expired; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: has been refused, which refusal has been appealed against but the appeal has not yet been determined.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (3) does not apply if, before the making of the application and in respect of an unauthorized development undertaken or continued on the land referred to in subsection (1), or any part of it—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: proceedings for the prosecution of an offence under section 20(8) or 21(2) of the Town Planning Ordinance (Cap. 131) have been instituted, whether against the applicant or any other person; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a notice—

subparagraph.content: has been served under section 23(1) or (2) of that Ordinance, whether on the applicant or any other person; and
has not been complied with or withdrawn.

subsection.leadIn: The condition is that an application for the renewal of an exemption, or the extension of a temporary suspension of liability, in respect of the pre-cut-off columbarium—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has been made but has not been determined;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has been refused, and the period within which a notice of appeal may be lodged against the refusal has not yet expired; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: has been refused, which refusal has been appealed against and is suspended from operation under section 43 pending the determination of the appeal.

section.name: s112
section.heading: Effect of Buildings Ordinance modified

subsection.leadIn: Sections 24(1) and 24C(1) of the Buildings Ordinance (Cap. 123) do not apply in respect of any non-compliant structures existing during a period merely because the structures have been completed, or building works relating to the structures have been carried out, in contravention of section 14(1) of that Ordinance if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the structures are necessary for, or ancillary to, the operation of a pre-cut-off columbarium; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: during the period—

subparagraph.content: the instrument-related condition is met in the manner specified in subsection (2), (3) or (5); and
the extent of breach condition specified in subsection (6) is met.

subsection.content: The instrument-related condition is met if a specified instrument is in force in respect of the pre-cut-off columbarium.

subsection.leadIn: The instrument-related condition is met if an application for the issue of a specified instrument in respect of the pre-cut-off columbarium—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has been made but has not been determined;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has been refused, and the period within which a notice of appeal may be lodged against the refusal has not yet expired; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: has been refused, which refusal has been appealed against but the appeal has not yet been determined.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (3) does not apply if, before the making of the application, an order or notice—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has been served under section 24(1) or issued under section 24C(1) (as the case requires) of the Buildings Ordinance (Cap. 123) in respect of the non-compliant structures referred to in subsection (1), or any part of them, whether on the applicant or any other person; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has not been complied with or withdrawn.

subsection.leadIn: The instrument-related condition is met if an application for the renewal of a licence or exemption, or the extension of a temporary suspension of liability, in respect of the pre-cut-off columbarium—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has been made but has not been determined;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has been refused, and the period within which a notice of appeal may be lodged against the refusal has not yet expired; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: has been refused, which refusal has been appealed against and is suspended from operation under section 43 pending the determination of the appeal.

subsection.leadIn: The extent of breach condition is that the non-compliant structures necessary for, or ancillary to, the operation of the pre-cut-off columbarium are limited to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if a temporary suspension of liability is issued or extended in respect of the columbarium—the non-compliant structures necessary for, or ancillary to, the operation of the columbarium, as shown in the approved plans annexed to the temporary suspension of liability;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if a licence or exemption is issued or renewed in respect of the columbarium—the structures certifiable for a pre-cut-off columbarium in, on or at the columbarium, as shown in the approved plans annexed to the licence or exemption (as the case requires); or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in any other case—the non-compliant structures necessary for, or ancillary to, the operation of the columbarium as at the cut-off time.

section.name: s113
section.heading: Provisions inapplicable because of section 110, 111 or 112 to resume application

subsection.content: Even if, because of the operation of section 110, 111 or 112, any provision of an Ordinance referred to in that section does not apply in respect of a pre-cut-off columbarium during a specified period, that fact does not in any way affect the application of the provision in respect of the columbarium after the period.

subsection.leadIn: In subsection (1)—
subsection.def: specified period (指明期間) means the period during which the conditions referred to in section 110(1), 111(1) or 112(1) (as the case requires) are met in respect of the pre-cut-off columbarium.

subsection.content: Subsection (1) does not affect the operation of section 109.

section.name: s1
section.heading: Constitution

subsection.content: The Licensing Board consists of not less than 7 members and not more than 9 members appointed by the Chief Executive. Any one or more of the members may be public officers.
The Chief Executive may appoint a member of the Licensing Board, either ex officio or personally, as the Chairperson of the Licensing Board.
The Chief Executive may appoint another member of the Licensing Board as the Deputy Chairperson of the Licensing Board.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to this Schedule, a member of the Licensing Board—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is to hold and vacate office in accordance with the member’s terms of appointment; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on ceasing to be a member, is eligible for reappointment.

subsection.content: An appointment under this section must be notified in the Gazette.
The notification is not subsidiary legislation.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Staff

subsection.content: The Secretary may appoint a secretary to the Licensing Board.
The Secretary may appoint a legal adviser to the Licensing Board.
The legal adviser may be present at any meeting, hearing or deliberation of the Licensing Board to advise the Licensing Board on legal matters.
The Secretary may appoint other staff to the Licensing Board as the Secretary considers necessary.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Committees

subsection.content: The Licensing Board may appoint committees to perform any of the functions of the Licensing Board.

subsection.leadIn: The Licensing Board may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: appoint a member of the Licensing Board to be the Chairperson of a committee; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: appoint any person to be a member of a committee.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Meetings of Licensing Board and committees

subsection.content: The Licensing Board or a committee may determine its practice and procedures at its meetings.
A quorum at a meeting of the Licensing Board is formed by 4 members of the Licensing Board, one of whom must be the Chairperson of the Licensing Board.

subsection.leadIn: If the Chairperson of the Licensing Board is absent or is otherwise unable to act—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Deputy Chairperson of the Licensing Board is to act as Chairperson of the Licensing Board; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the Deputy Chairperson of the Licensing Board is absent or is otherwise unable to act—a member of the Licensing Board named by the Secretary is to act as Chairperson of the Licensing Board.

subsection.content: One-third of the members of a committee, one of whom must be the Chairperson of the committee, are to form a quorum at a meeting of the committee.
If the Chairperson of a committee is absent or is otherwise unable to act, a member of the committee named by the Director is to act as Chairperson of the committee.

The Chairperson of the Licensing Board or a committee (as the case requires) is to have a casting vote in case of an equality of votes for and against a motion at a meeting of the Licensing Board or committee.
Business of the Licensing Board or any committee may be transacted by way of meetings or circulation of papers.
A meeting of the Licensing Board or a committee is to be open to the public unless the Licensing Board or committee determines that there is a good reason for it to be held in private.

If a member of the Licensing Board or a committee is disqualified from taking part in a decision or deliberation in respect of a matter under section 5 of this Schedule, the member must be disregarded for the purposes of constituting the quorum for deciding or deliberating on that matter.

subsection.leadIn: To avoid doubt—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in subsections (2) and (6), a reference to the Chairperson of the Licensing Board includes a reference to a person who acts as Chairperson of the Licensing Board under subsection (3); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in subsections (4) and (6), a reference to the Chairperson of a committee includes a reference to a person who acts as Chairperson of the committee under subsection (5).

section.name: s5
section.heading: Disclosure of interests of member
section.leadIn: If a member of the Licensing Board or a committee has a direct or indirect interest in any matter under consideration at a meeting of the Licensing Board or committee (as the case requires), the member—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: must disclose to the Licensing Board or committee (as the case requires) the nature of the interest—

subparagraph.content: before the meeting begins; or
if it comes to the notice of the member after the meeting begins that he or she has such an interest—as soon as practicable after the meeting begins;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must withdraw from the meeting while the Licensing Board or committee (as the case requires) is considering the matter if so required by the meeting; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: must not participate in any deliberation or be involved in any decision regarding the matter.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Delegation

subsection.content: The Licensing Board may, in writing, delegate any of its functions or powers to a public officer.

subsection.leadIn: However, the Licensing Board may not delegate its power to do any of the following things—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: delegate under subsection (1);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: approve or refuse an application for a specified instrument;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: approve or refuse an application for the transfer of a specified instrument;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: revoke or suspend a specified instrument or an authorization under a licence to sell interment rights;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: impose or vary any condition to which a specified instrument is subject;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: approve a management plan of a columbarium for the purpose of an application for a licence;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: endorse a register required for the purpose of an application for an exemption;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: approve plans of a columbarium for the purpose of an application for a specified instrument;
vary any particular shown in approved plans or contained in an endorsed register or vary any matter covered in an approved management plan;

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: determine the validity period of a specified instrument;

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.content: determine any date for review of a licence;
suspend the operation of a decision of the Licensing Board;

paragraph.name: m
paragraph.content: approve or refuse an application for permission for alteration or addition to columbarium premises;

paragraph.name: n
paragraph.content: amend any Schedule (or part of it) to this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: o
paragraph.content: appoint a committee or the Chairperson or a member of a committee.

schedule.name: sch2
schedule.heading: Requirements Relevant to Eligibility for Specified Instruments

section.name: s1
section.heading: Compliance with land-related requirements
section.leadIn: A columbarium complies with the land-related requirements only if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the operation of the columbarium does not involve unlawful occupation of unleased land; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the requirements in respect of the columbarium under the lease, short term tenancy or other instrument, under which the columbarium premises are held directly from the Government, are complied with.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Compliance with planning-related requirements
section.content: A columbarium complies with the planning-related requirements only if the columbarium complies with every requirement under the Town Planning Ordinance (Cap. 131).

section.name: s3
section.heading: Compliance with building-related requirements

subsection.leadIn: A columbarium complies with the building-related requirements only if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the columbarium complies with the requirements for approval and consent to the commencement of building works under section 14 of the Buildings Ordinance (Cap. 123) and every other requirement specified by the Licensing Board including requirements relating to design, construction, structure, fire precautions, health, sanitation or safety; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the following requirements are met in respect of every building or building works in, on or at the columbarium—

subparagraph.content: the building or building works form the whole, or a part, of a certifiable building;
the certifiable building is certified to be structurally safe by a qualified professional, to the satisfaction of the Licensing Board; and
any works that the Licensing Board may require in respect of the certifiable building have been carried out in accordance with the requirements that the Licensing Board thinks fit to impose.

subsection.content: The specification of requirements under subsection (1)(a) is not subsidiary legislation.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: certifiable building (可核證建築物) means—(a)an NT small building that came into existence on or after 16 October 1987 and in respect of which a certificate of exemption has been issued under the Buildings Ordinance (Application to the New Territories) Ordinance (Cap. 121);(b)an NT small building that—(i)came into existence on or after 1 January 1961 and before 16 October 1987; and(ii)complied with the repealed Buildings Ordinance (Application to the New Territories) Ordinance at the time of its erection;(c)a pre-1961 NT building; or(d)a building situated on land—(i)that was unleased land at the time the building was erected; and(ii)in respect of which—(A)a lease under which the columbarium premises are held directly from the Government; or(B)a short term tenancy under which the columbarium premises are occupied,is subsequently granted by the Government before the enactment date.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this section—
subsection.def: New Territories (新界) does not include New Kowloon;

pre-1961 NT building (1961年前新界建築物) means a building in the New Territories built before 1 January 1961 where there has been no alteration or addition to, or reconstruction of, the building in contravention of the Buildings Ordinance (Cap. 123) on or after that date;

repealed Buildings Ordinance (Application to the New Territories) Ordinance (已廢除的《建築物條例(新界適用)條例》) means the Buildings Ordinance (Application to the New Territories) Ordinance that came into operation on 1 January 1961 and was repealed and replaced by the Buildings Ordinance (Application to the New Territories) Ordinance (Cap. 121).

section.name: s4
section.heading: Requirements applicable to structures certifiable for a pre-cut-off columbarium

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: structures certifiable for a pre-cut-off columbarium (可就截算前骨灰安置所核證的構築物) means non-compliant structures existing immediately before the cut-off time that—(a)fall within the following description—(i)they contain niches used or intended to be used for the interment of ashes where at least a niche in the structures was so used immediately before the cut-off time;(ii)they are otherwise used for the interment of ashes and were so used immediately before the cut-off time; or(iii)they form the whole, or a part, of any essential ancillary facilities supporting the operation of the columbarium; and(b)fall within the following description—(i)they are on-grade outdoor structures with niches;(ii)they form the whole, or a part, of a single-storey building;(iii)they form the whole, or a part, of the ground storey of a multi-storey building but do not form the whole, or any part, of any other storey of the building; or(iv)they form the whole, or a part, of a multi-storey building that is an NT small building (as defined by section 3(4) of this Schedule)—(A)that came into existence on or after 16 October 1987; and(B)in respect of which a certificate of exemption has not been issued under the Buildings Ordinance (Application to the New Territories) Ordinance (Cap. 121).

subsection.leadIn: In paragraph (b) of the definition of structures certifiable for a pre-cut-off columbarium in subsection (1), a reference to a building—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: is a reference to any building (having the meaning given by section 2(1) of the Buildings Ordinance (Cap. 123)), including such a building situated on land that was unleased land at the time the building was erected—

subparagraph.content: without a licence issued under section 5 of the Land (Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 28); or
in breach of such a licence; but

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: does not include a reference to a building situated in or on another building that complies with the requirements for approval and consent to the commencement of building works under section 14 of the Buildings Ordinance (Cap. 123).

subsection.leadIn: The requirements applicable to structures certifiable for a pre-cut-off columbarium for the purposes of sections 19(2) and 20(1)(g)(ii) of this Ordinance are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a qualified professional must certify, to the satisfaction of the Licensing Board, that—

subparagraph.content: if paragraph (b)(i) of the definition of structures certifiable for a pre-cut-off columbarium in subsection (1) applies—the on-grade outdoor structures with niches are structurally safe; or
if paragraph (b)(ii), (iii) or (iv) of that definition applies—the building referred to in that paragraph is structurally safe; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any works that the Licensing Board may require in respect of on-grade outdoor structures with niches or the building (as the case requires) have been carried out in accordance with the requirements that the Licensing Board thinks fit to impose.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this section—
subsection.def: ground storey (地面樓層) means—(a)the storey in which an entrance from a street to the building is situated; or(b)if—(i)a building fronts or abuts on more than one street; and(ii)due to a difference in street levels there are 2 or more entrances serving different streets and situated in different storeys,each of those storeys.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Meaning of small building

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of sections 3 and 4 of this Schedule—
subsection.def: small building (小型建築物) means a building that meets the descriptions in subsection (2).

subsection.leadIn: The building is of not more than 3 storeys and is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: of a height of more than 7.62 m but not more than 8.23 m and with a roofed-over area not exceeding 65.03 m2, and in respect of which each load-bearing wall is of a thickness as follows—

subparagraph.content: in the case of a load-bearing reinforced concrete wall—not less than 175 mm;
in the case of a load-bearing brick wall of the lowest storey—not less than 340 mm;
in the case of a load-bearing brick wall of any higher storey—not less than 225 mm; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: of a height of not more than 7.62 m with a roofed-over area not exceeding 65.03 m2.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Meaning of height, roofed-over area, building, etc. in section 5 of this Schedule

subsection.content: This section applies for the purposes of the construction of section 5 of this Schedule.
Height (高度) means the perpendicular height of the building measured from the level of its lowest point at ground level to the level of the highest point of its roof.

subsection.leadIn: In determining the highest point of a roof, no account is to be taken of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: 1 stairhood if it has a roof area of not more than 7.44 m2, a height of not more than 2.14 m and is erected and used solely to provide protection from rain and sun for a stairway used to gain access to the roof of the building;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any parapet on the roof if the height is not more than 1.22 m; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: 1 water storage tank if it has a roof area of not more than 2 m2, a height of not more than 1.22 m and is installed at any point on the roof other than on a stairhood.

subsection.leadIn: Roofed-over area (有蓋面積) means the area of a building enclosed within the exterior faces of the external walls (which includes any party wall) of that building together with the area of any balcony, stairway, verandah, porch, canopy or any other projection from the building. For the purpose of calculating the roofed-over area of any building, the area of not more than 2 balconies and 1 canopy is to be excluded if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: they all project from the same side of the building for a distance of not more than 1.22 m; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: they are not enclosed.

subsection.leadIn: If a building is divided into separate units by means of one or more party walls, each such unit is to be considered to be a separate building for the purposes of section 5 of this Schedule, if any such party wall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if that building is of a height of not more than 7.62 m—is a load-bearing brick wall of not less than 225 mm thick;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if that building is of a height of more than 7.62 m but not more than 8.23 m—

subparagraph.content: for the lowest storey—is a load-bearing brick wall of not less than 340 mm thick; and
for any higher storey—is a load-bearing brick wall of not less than 225 mm thick; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: is a load-bearing reinforced concrete wall of not less than 175 mm thick.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Meaning of undefined word or phrase
section.leadIn: For the purposes of this Part, a word or phrase not defined in this Part or section 2(1) of this Ordinance has the meaning (if any) given by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: section 2 of the Buildings Ordinance (Cap. 123); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: section 2 of the Buildings Ordinance (Application to the New Territories) Ordinance (Cap. 121).

schedule.name: sch3
schedule.heading: Further Provisions on Applications Relating to Specified Instruments

section.name: s1
section.heading: Applications to which Schedule 3 applies
section.leadIn: This Schedule applies to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an application for a specified instrument under section 13 of this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an application for the transfer of a specified instrument under section 39 of this Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an application for varying a condition of a specified instrument under section 41 of this Ordinance.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Who may make application

subsection.leadIn: An application to which this Schedule applies may only be made by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person who operates, keeps, manages or in any other way has control of a columbarium; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person who intends to operate, keep, manage or in any other way have control of a columbarium.

subsection.leadIn: The application must be signed—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the applicant is a natural person—by the applicant;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the applicant is a partner in a partnership—by the partner authorized in writing to act for and on behalf of the partnership;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the applicant is a body corporate—by a director or other officer concerned in the management of the body corporate authorized in writing to act for and on behalf of the body corporate.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Certification as to building safety, fire safety, etc.
section.leadIn: For the purposes of an application to which this Schedule applies, the Licensing Board may require—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: certification as to building safety and compliance with the prevailing building safety and fire safety standards as well as structural, drainage and sewage requirements by a qualified professional; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: certificates of fire service installations and equipment to prove that they are in efficient working order.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Publication etc. of notices of licence applications

subsection.leadIn: If the Licensing Board considers it appropriate to do so in relation to an application for the issue of a licence in respect of a columbarium, the Licensing Board may do any one or more of the following—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: causing a notice of the application to be published at the expense of the applicant in an English language newspaper and a Chinese language newspaper in general circulation in Hong Kong determined by the Licensing Board;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: posting a notice of the application at a conspicuous place outside the columbarium.

subsection.content: A notice published or posted under subsection (1) must state the place or places where the particulars of the application may be inspected.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Notification of decision about application for specified instrument
section.leadIn: On determining an application referred to in section 1(a) of this Schedule, the Licensing Board must notify the applicant in writing of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Licensing Board’s decision; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the application is refused—the reasons for the refusal.

schedule.name: sch4
schedule.heading: Prescribed Information, Recommendations and Essential Terms in Agreement for Sale of Interment Right

section.name: s1
section.leadIn: An agreement for the sale of an interment right must set out all of the following information and recommendations—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: information about the seller’s licence (name of licensee, address of the licensed premises, licence number and the validity period of the licence);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: information about ownership, tenancy, encumbrances and restrictions on use and disposition—

subparagraph.leadIn: whether the seller is the owner of the columbarium premises held directly from the Government under a lease and, if so—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: whether the seller is the sole owner, the joint owners or the co-owners;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: the name of the sole owner, or the names of the joint owners or the co-owners;

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: in the case of co-ownership—each co-owner’s respective share or interest in the premises; and

subparagraph.name: D
subparagraph.content: the following particulars of the lease—
the lot number of the premises; and
the date on which the term of the lease is to end;

subparagraph.leadIn: whether the seller occupies the columbarium premises under a tenancy and, if so—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the name of the landlord;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: the periodic basis for the payment of rent for the tenancy;

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.leadIn: the terms in the tenancy agreement—

subparagraph.content: on the arrangements for the termination of the tenancy; and
on the arrangements for the renewal of the tenancy; and

subparagraph.name: D
subparagraph.leadIn: the following particulars of the tenancy—

subparagraph.content: the lot number of the premises;
if applicable—the memorial number (where available) of the tenancy agreement;
for a short term tenancy—the short term tenancy number assigned by the Lands Department; and
the date on which the term of the tenancy is to end;

subparagraph.leadIn: whether mortgage or any other encumbrance subsists in the columbarium premises that may jeopardize the purchaser’s interest and, if so—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the name of the mortgagee or the person entitled to the benefit of, or to require payment or discharge of, the encumbrance (as the case requires); and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: if applicable—the memorial number (where available) of the mortgage or encumbrance;

whether the columbarium premises are prevented, by an instrument registered in the Land Registry, from being used or disposed of in a manner that may jeopardize the purchaser’s interest and, if so, the memorial number of the instrument;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a recommendation that the purchaser should carefully consider whether the purchaser’s interest is protected against the financial risks involved with lump sum prepayment for an interment right for a long period;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a recommendation that the purchaser should seek legal advice if the purchaser does not understand any part of the information, recommendations or terms in the agreement.

section.name: s2
section.leadIn: An agreement for the sale of an interment right must set out—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the names of the parties to the agreement;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a full description of the interment right sold, specifying—

subparagraph.leadIn: if the interment right relates to a niche—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the location, serial numbering and dimensions of the niche; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: the maximum number (if applicable) of containers of ashes that are permitted to be interred in the niche;

subparagraph.leadIn: if the interment right relates to a niche—the nature of the right or interest that the interment right comprises, whether it is—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: an interest in land;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: a right under a tenancy or service agreement to use the niche; or

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: a right or interest of any other nature;
the duration of the interment right; and
particulars about any right of the purchaser to renew the interment right for another term, on the expiry of the term under the agreement;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any other services to be provided under the agreement;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: a comprehensive list of all fees, charges and other sums payable by the purchaser (whether recurrent or non-recurrent), specifying—

subparagraph.content: the precise purposes for which the fees, charges and sums are payable under the agreement;
the amounts of the fees, charges and sums and the mechanism for any future revision of the fees, charges and sums; and

payment methods (whether periodic payments during the period for which the interment right lasts, or payment by instalments payable on the commencement of each validity period of the seller’s licence, or any other payment method);

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: without limiting paragraph (d) and if the interment right includes a right to renew the interment right on the seller being granted a renewed term of the lease under which the columbarium premises are held directly from the Government—any contribution due from the purchaser to the seller towards the premium payable by the seller to the Government, expressed as a share of the premium;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.leadIn: the following essential terms—

subparagraph.content: arrangements for naming a dedicated person and effecting changes of the dedicated person;
arrangements for appointing and replacing authorized representatives;
arrangements for authorizing a person to enforce the agreement; and

the circumstances and the manner in which the operation of the agreement may be temporarily suspended or the agreement may be terminated otherwise than on the expiry of the term of the interment right; and

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.leadIn: the arrangements for handling interred ashes in the event of—

subparagraph.content: the temporary suspension of operation of the agreement; or
the termination of the agreement (whether on expiry of the term of the interment right or not).

section.name: s3
section.leadIn: In this Schedule—
section.def: memorial number (註冊摘要編號) has the meaning given by regulation 2 of the Land Registration Regulations (Cap. 128 sub. leg. A);
purchaser (買方)—see section 49(1) of this Ordinance;
seller (賣方)—see section 49(1) of this Ordinance.

section.name: s4
section.content: This Schedule applies to an agreement for the sale of an interment right entered into on or after the enactment date.

schedule.name: sch5
schedule.heading: Occupation Order and Ash Disposal Procedures

section.name: s1
section.heading: Interpretation of Part 1 of Schedule 5
section.leadIn: In this Part—
section.def: instrument holder (文書持有人) means a person to whom a specified instrument has been issued, whether the instrument is still in force, has expired without being renewed or extended or is revoked or suspended.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Procedures for application for occupation order

subsection.content: The Chief Justice may, by practice directions, provide for the procedures for making an application for, or otherwise in relation to, an occupation order under section 76 of this Ordinance.
Practice directions referred to in subsection (1) are not subsidiary legislation.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Making of occupation order

subsection.leadIn: A magistrate may not make an occupation order under section 76 of this Ordinance in respect of a columbarium unless, at least 30 days before the hearing of the application—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a specified officer—

subparagraph.leadIn: has given a notice of the hearing of the application—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: to the owner of the columbarium premises; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: to the instrument holder (if any) in respect of the columbarium; and
has posted a notice of the hearing at a conspicuous place outside the columbarium; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: each of the notices states the date, time and venue of the hearing.

subsection.leadIn: If a magistrate makes an occupation order in respect of a columbarium, the specified officer must do both of the following within 7 days after the day the order is made—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: give notice of the order—

subparagraph.content: to the owner of the columbarium premises; and
to the instrument holder (if any) in respect of the columbarium;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: post a copy of the order at a conspicuous place outside the columbarium.

subsection.content: An occupation order takes effect on the date set out in the order.

Proceedings before a magistrate for the purposes of this section are deemed to be proceedings which a magistrate has power to determine in a summary way within the meaning of sections 105 and 113(3) of the Magistrates Ordinance (Cap. 227) and, accordingly, Part VII of that Ordinance (which relates to appeals) applies, with necessary modifications, to appeals against an occupation order.

A person who, without lawful authority or reasonable excuse, removes or defaces a notice posted under subsection (1)(a)(ii) or a copy of an occupation order posted under subsection (2)(b) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Restriction on entry into columbarium subject to occupation order

subsection.content: When an occupation order in respect of any columbarium comes into force, a specified officer may lock or seal, or cause to be locked or sealed, all or any of the entrances to or exits from the columbarium premises, or any part of them.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (3), a person must not enter or remain on the premises of any columbarium subject to an occupation order, or any part of them, unless the person is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a specified officer acting in the course of his or her duty; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a specified officer’s agent acting in connection with performance of the duty.

subsection.leadIn: While a columbarium is subject to an occupation order, the specified officer may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: permit, in writing, any person to enter and remain on the columbarium premises, or any part of them, for a purpose specified in the permit;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: impose on the permit conditions that the specified officer thinks fit;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: revoke the permit if the specified officer thinks that the purpose for which the permit was granted no longer exists or any condition imposed under paragraph (b) has been breached; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: request any person found on the columbarium premises, or any part of them, to leave and, if the person refuses to leave, remove the person from the premises or part, with any assistance of police officers and using any force that is reasonably necessary.

subsection.content: A person who, without lawful authority or reasonable excuse, breaks or interferes with any lock or seal made under subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 6 months.
A person who, without lawful authority or reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (2) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 12 months.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Variation or cancellation of occupation order

subsection.content: The owner of the premises that are a columbarium subject to an occupation order, or the instrument holder (if any) in respect of the columbarium, may apply to a magistrate for a variation, or the cancellation, of the order.
The applicant must serve a copy of the application on the Director, who is entitled to be heard on the application.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Interpretation of Part 2 of Schedule 5

subsection.content: In this Part, a reference to arranging for the return of the ashes interred in a columbarium on-site is a reference to making available the ashes for return at the columbarium at reasonable hours during a period (which period is referred to as an on-site claim period and is to be construed as including the 2 months referred to in section 9(2) or 10(3)(a)(i) of this Schedule).

subsection.leadIn: In this Part—
subsection.def: ash handler (骨灰處理者) means a person who is required under section 68(2)(b), 73 or 75(2) of this Ordinance to carry out the prescribed ash disposal procedures in respect of a columbarium;

eligible claimant (合資格申索人), in relation to the ashes of a deceased person or any related items, means—(a)unless paragraph (b) applies, a prescribed claimant; or(b)the owner of the item or the person to whom the ashes are to be returned (as the case requires) as determined in accordance with any applicable law;

personal representative (遺產代理人), in relation to a deceased person, means—(a)a personal representative within the meaning of section 2 of the Probate and Administration Ordinance (Cap. 10); or(b)if the Official Administrator gets in and administers an estate in a summary manner under section 15 of that Ordinance—the Official Administrator;

prescribed claimant (訂明申索人), in relation to the ashes of a deceased person, means—(a)an authorized representative;(b)a personal representative or relative;(c)a related person; or(d)the purchaser of the interment right;
related item (相關物品), in relation to ashes, means—(a)the container of the ashes; or(b)an item interred together with the ashes in the same container;

related person (相關人士), in relation to a deceased person, means a person who—(a)was living with the deceased person in the same household immediately before the date of the death of the deceased person; and(b)had been living with the deceased person in the same household for at least 2 years before that date;

relative (親屬), in relation to the ashes of a deceased person, means—(a)the deceased’s spouse;(b)the deceased’s father, mother, grandfather or grandmother (whether natural or adoptive);(c)the deceased’s step-father, step-mother, step-grandfather or step-grandmother;(d)the deceased’s father-in-law or mother-in-law who is the natural parent, adoptive parent or step-parent of the deceased’s spouse;(e)the deceased’s grandfather-in-law or grandmother-in-law who is the natural grandparent, adoptive grandparent or step-grandparent of the deceased’s spouse;(f)the deceased’s son, daughter, grandson or granddaughter (whether natural or adoptive);(g)the deceased’s step-son, step-daughter, step-grandson or step-granddaughter;(h)the deceased’s son-in-law or daughter-in-law who is the spouse of the deceased’s natural child, adoptive child or step-child;(i)the deceased’s grandson-in-law or granddaughter-in-law who is the spouse of the deceased’s natural grandchild, adoptive grandchild or step-grandchild;(j)the deceased’s brother or sister (whether of full or half blood or by virtue of adoption);(k)the brother or sister (whether of full or half blood or by virtue of adoption) of the deceased’s spouse;(l)the deceased’s step-brother or step-sister;(m)the step-brother or step-sister of the deceased’s spouse;(n)the deceased’s uncle, aunt, nephew, niece or cousin (whether of full or half blood or by virtue of adoption);(o)the uncle, aunt, nephew, niece or cousin (whether of full or half blood or by virtue of adoption) of the deceased’s spouse; or(p)the spouse of any person mentioned in paragraph (j), (k), (l), (m), (n) or (o);
