return order (交還令) means an order for the return of ashes made under section 77 of this Ordinance.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Prescribed ash disposal procedures

subsection.leadIn: Subject to section 18 of this Schedule, an ash handler carries out the prescribed ash disposal procedures in respect of a columbarium (columbarium A) if the ash handler—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: gives a commencement of ash disposal notice stating the person’s intention—

subparagraph.content: to handle the ashes interred in the columbarium in the specified manner within the meaning of subsection (2) or (3); and
to handle claims for the return of ashes in accordance with sections 9 and 10 of this Schedule;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: handles the ashes and claims in accordance with the intention stated in the notice;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: takes the steps required by the Director under section 13 of this Schedule; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: complies with the requirement under section 12 of this Schedule for the delivery of a record of the procedures to the Director.

subsection.leadIn: The ash handler handles the ashes in the specified manner for the purposes of subsection (1)(a)(i) if the ash handler—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: arranges for the return of ashes on-site, allowing for an on-site claim period of at least 12 months; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: after the expiry of the on-site claim period, delivers to the Director, in a manner specified by the Director, the ashes that are not returned to an eligible claimant.

subsection.leadIn: The ash handler also handles the ashes in the specified manner for the purposes of subsection (1)(a)(i) if the ash handler—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: arranges for the return of ashes on-site, allowing for an on-site claim period of at least 8 months; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: after the expiry of the on-site claim period—

subparagraph.content: arranges for the removal from columbarium A of the ashes that are not returned to an eligible claimant; and

subparagraph.leadIn: arranges for the reinterment of the ashes—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: in a columbarium (columbarium B) in respect of which a licence is in force and not suspended or to which this Ordinance does not apply because of section 4 of this Ordinance; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: on terms no less favourable than the terms governing interment of the ashes in columbarium A.

subsection.content: Subsection (2)(b) has effect subject to sections 9(6) and 10(5)(b) of this Schedule.

section.name: s8
section.heading: Commencement of ash disposal notice

subsection.content: For the purposes of section 7(1)(a) of this Schedule, an ash handler must give a commencement of ash disposal notice, stating the ash handler’s intention regarding disposal of the ashes, before opening sealed niches in the columbarium or otherwise starting to handle the ashes in the columbarium.

subsection.leadIn: A commencement of ash disposal notice must be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: published in 3 newspapers (of which 1 must be in English and 1 must be in Chinese) in general circulation in Hong Kong at least once in each of 2 consecutive weeks;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: posted at a conspicuous place outside the columbarium;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: served on the Licensing Board; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: served on each specified addressee (if any).

subsection.leadIn: In subsection (2)—
subsection.def: specified addressee (指明收訊者), in relation to ashes interred under an agreement for the sale of an interment right, means—(a)an authorized representative (where available);(b)the purchaser; or(c)any other person available whose contact details are entered into any register or record kept under this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: A commencement of ash disposal notice must contain—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name and address of the columbarium in respect of which the prescribed ash disposal procedures are to be carried out;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a statement of the intention of the ash handler giving the notice with respect to the manner of ash disposal specifying—

subparagraph.content: that the prescribed ash disposal procedures are to be carried out;

which of section 7(2) or (3) of this Schedule are the ashes to be handled in accordance with or (if applicable) that the ashes are to be handled in accordance with section 7(2) and (3) of this Schedule; and

subparagraph.leadIn: the particulars relating to the intended handling of the ashes including—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the date on which the on-site claim period begins (which must be no earlier than the expiry of 14 days, and no later than the expiry of 30 days, immediately after the date of the commencement of ash disposal notice) and the date on which the on-site claim period ends;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: if applicable—the date by which the ashes, if not returned to an eligible claimant, are to be reinterred and the address of the columbarium in which the ashes are to be reinterred and the terms of reinterment; and

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: if sub-subparagraph (B) does not apply—the date by which the ashes, if not returned to an eligible claimant, are to be delivered to the Director and that the ashes are to be finally disposed of in a manner that the Director thinks fit; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a statement that the carrying out of the prescribed ash disposal procedures does not affect any person’s right to compensation under an agreement for the sale of an interment right.

subsection.content: The particulars specified in the commencement of ash disposal notice must conform to the requirements of section 7(2) or (3), or section 7(2) and (3), of this Schedule (as the case requires) about the handling of ashes.

section.name: s9
section.heading: Handling claims for ashes—general

subsection.content: This section applies subject to section 10 of this Schedule.
The ashes of a deceased person may only be returned on the expiry of the first 2 months of the on-site claim period (the first 2 months).

subsection.leadIn: After the expiry of the first 2 months, the ash handler must return the ashes of a deceased person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the ash handler receives only 1 claim for the return of the ashes from a prescribed claimant—to the prescribed claimant; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if the ash handler receives competing claims for the return of the ashes from 2 or more prescribed claimants—

subparagraph.content: to the prescribed claimant whose claim has the highest priority under subsection (5); or
if the competing claims are of equal priority—in accordance with subsection (6).

subsection.leadIn: If, by the expiry of the first 2 months, the ash handler does not receive any claim for the return of the ashes of a deceased person from a person who is a prescribed claimant—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the ash handler must return the ashes to a prescribed claimant who first makes a claim in the remainder of the on-site claim period; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if competing claims are received from 2 or more prescribed claimants before the ashes are returned under paragraph (a)—

subparagraph.content: the ash handler must return the ashes to the prescribed claimant whose claim has the highest priority under subsection (5); or
if the competing claims are of equal priority—the ash handler must return the ashes in accordance with subsection (6).

subsection.leadIn: The following rules apply in determining the priority of competing claims among prescribed claimants for the return of the ashes of a deceased person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: among competing claims from 2 or more authorized representatives—

subparagraph.content: the order of priority follows that stated in the agreement for the sale of the interment right concerned; or
if no order of priority is stated, the claims have equal priority;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an authorized representative’s claim has priority over that of a personal representative, relative or related person or of the purchaser;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a claim of a personal representative or relative has priority over that of a related person or of the purchaser;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a personal representative’s claim and a relative’s claim have equal priority; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: a related person’s claim has priority over that of the purchaser.

subsection.leadIn: If the ash handler receives competing claims as referred to in subsection (3)(b)(ii) or (4)(b)(ii), the ash handler—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must keep the ashes until a return order is made for their return to one or more prescribed claimants and must return the ashes as ordered; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if no court proceedings have been instituted by the expiry of 12 months after the on-site claim period—must deliver the ashes to the Director.

section.name: s10
section.heading: Handling claims for ashes—if there is claim for related item

subsection.content: This section applies instead of section 9 of this Schedule if, before the ashes of a deceased person (together with any related items) are returned to any person under that section, a person claims to be the owner of a related item.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: specified item (指明物品) means the ashes of the deceased person, together with all related items (if applicable); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: claim for return (交還申索) means any claim for the return of the ashes of the deceased person or a related item, or both.

subsection.leadIn: The ash handler must return the specified item—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: where the person who claims to be the owner of the related item is a prescribed claimant—

subparagraph.content: if the ash handler receives only the claim for return from that person within the first 2 months of the on-site claim period (the first 2 months)—to that person after the expiry of the first 2 months; or

if, by the expiry of the first 2 months, the ash handler does not receive any claim for return and that person is the first one who makes such a claim in the remainder of the on-site claim period—to that person; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where the person who claims to be the owner of the related item is not a prescribed claimant and if, throughout the on-site claim period, the ash handler does not receive any other claim for return—to that person after the expiry of the on-site claim period.

subsection.content: Subsection (5) applies if, before the specified item is returned in accordance with subsection (3), the ash handler receives another claim for return.

subsection.leadIn: In the circumstances specified in subsection (4)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the court may determine the claims for return in accordance with any applicable law; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the ash handler—

subparagraph.content: must keep the specified item until a return order is made for its return to one or more persons and must return it as ordered; or
if no court proceedings have been instituted by the expiry of 12 months after the on-site claim period—must deliver the specified item to the Director.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this section, the ash handler is not under any obligation to open any container containing ashes in order to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: ascertain if there is any related item inside the container; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: return any related item without returning the ashes together with it.

section.name: s11
section.heading: Court order for return of ashes

subsection.leadIn: An application for a return order may be made, by originating summons, by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a prescribed claimant;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person who claims to be the owner of a related item;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an ash handler to which section 9(6) or 10(5)(b) of this Schedule applies; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: if the Director is in possession of the ashes by virtue of any provision of this Ordinance—the Director.

subsection.leadIn: If an application for a return order is made by an ash handler or the Director—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: Order 17 of the Rules of the District Court (Cap. 336 sub. leg. H) applies, with necessary modifications, in relation to the application as if it were an application for relief by way of interpleader; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the court has the powers under that Order accordingly despite section 32(3) of the District Court Ordinance (Cap. 336).

subsection.content: Despite subsections (1) and (2), the District Court Rules Committee established under section 17 of the District Court Ordinance (Cap. 336) may make rules to provide for the procedures for making an application for a return order.

subsection.leadIn: On making a return order, the court—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may impose any conditions that it considers appropriate; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: may order that the ashes be returned in any manner it thinks fit, including—

subparagraph.content: separating any related item (except the container of the ashes) from the ashes; and
returning different related items to different persons.

section.name: s12
section.heading: Record

subsection.leadIn: An ash handler must keep a record of the steps that the ash handler has taken to carry out the prescribed ash disposal procedures, which record—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be in the form specified by the Director; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must contain the information that the Director requires about ashes and claims handled in carrying out the procedures.

subsection.content: Subject to subsections (3) and (4), the ash handler must deliver the record to the Director within 30 days after the expiry of the on-site claim period.

subsection.leadIn: If section 9(6) of this Schedule applies to the ashes of a deceased person, the period within which the ash handler must deliver the part of the record, relating to the ashes of the deceased person, to the Director is 30 days after the earlier of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the return of the ashes under that section;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the expiry of 12 months after the on-site claim period.

subsection.leadIn: If section 10(5)(b) of this Schedule applies to the ashes of a deceased person and any related items, the period within which the ash handler must deliver the part of the record, relating to the ashes of the deceased person and the items, to the Director is 30 days after the earlier of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the return of the ashes and items under that section;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the expiry of 12 months after the on-site claim period.

section.name: s13
section.heading: Further steps to facilitate return of ashes
section.leadIn: The Director or an authorized officer may, by notice in writing, require an ash handler to take any steps that the Director considers necessary to facilitate—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the return of ashes to their eligible claimants;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the delivery of ashes to the Director; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the reinterment of ashes.

section.name: s14
section.heading: Director carrying out steps necessary for disposal of ashes

subsection.content: Subsections (2), (3) and (4) apply if the Director has in his or her possession ashes in respect of which the prescribed ash disposal procedures have, or any step in them has, not been carried out, whether or not after a contravention of section 68, 69, 70, 72, 73 or 75 of this Ordinance.

The Director may, under section 76(1) of this Ordinance, carry out the steps that the Director considers necessary for disposal of ashes (to the extent that there are steps in the prescribed ash disposal procedures that have not been carried out).
The Director must keep a record of the process of the steps carried out under section 76(1) of this Ordinance.

Sections 7, 8, 9 and 10 of this Schedule apply, with any necessary modifications, to the Director for the purposes of disposal of ashes to the extent to which those sections provide for the steps that the Director considers necessary for the disposal.

section.name: s15
section.heading: Director’s power to dispose of ashes

subsection.content: Any ashes in the Director’s possession in respect of which the prescribed ash disposal procedures, or the steps that a specified officer considers necessary for disposal of ashes, have been carried out may be disposed of by the Director in any manner that the Director thinks fit.
Subsection (1) does not apply to any ashes in respect of which proceedings are pending in the court and a person has, by written notice, informed the Director of the proceedings.

section.name: s16
section.heading: Director recovering expenses of steps carried out for disposal of ashes

subsection.leadIn: A person is liable to pay to the Director all expenses that the Director incurs in carrying out the steps that the Director considers necessary for disposal of ashes in respect of a columbarium if the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is required under section 68(2)(b), 73 or 75(2) of this Ordinance to carry out the prescribed ash disposal procedures; but

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has not done so.

subsection.leadIn: To avoid doubt, for the purposes of subsection (1)(a), a person is regarded as being required under section 68(2)(b) of this Ordinance to carry out the prescribed ash disposal procedures if the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has abandoned the columbarium as referred to in section 69 or 70 of this Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: does not continue to operate the columbarium as required by section 72 of this Ordinance.

subsection.content: The Director may issue a certificate to certify the expenses incurred in respect of a columbarium as mentioned in subsection (1).
Without limiting the general meaning of expenses, the expenses may include supervision and departmental charges and legal costs.
The Director must serve a copy of the certificate on each person whom the Director believes to be liable to pay the expenses.

Interest is recoverable as part of the expenses from a person who is liable for the expenses under subsection (1) at the annual rate of 10% commencing 1 month after the date of service of the certificate on the person.
Payment of the expenses by any person is without prejudice to the person’s right to recover the payment from any other person who is liable to pay for the expenses.
The expenses due from a person to the Director under this section are recoverable as a civil debt due to the Government.
A certificate purporting to be signed by the Director under subsection (3) is on its production admissible in any proceedings without further proof.
The certificate is presumed, in the absence of evidence to the contrary, to be proof of the signature of the Director and of the amount of expenses due from a person referred to in subsection (1).

subsection.leadIn: Where any person liable to pay the expenses is the owner of the columbarium premises, then—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: at any time before the expenses (including the interest accrued) have been recovered in full, the certificate under subsection (3) may be registered in the Land Registry against the premises; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: upon the registration, the expenses (including any interest recoverable under subsection (6)) constitute a legal charge on the columbarium premises.

subsection.content: Upon the recovery of the expenses (including the interest accrued) in full, the Director is to lodge, or cause to be lodged, in the Land Registry a memorial of satisfaction against the certificate.

section.name: s17
section.heading: Director to provide information on ash disposal by columbaria

subsection.leadIn: The Director must keep—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a list setting out—

subparagraph.content: each columbarium in respect of which the prescribed ash disposal procedures are being carried out;
each columbarium in respect of which the prescribed ash disposal procedures have been carried out;
each columbarium in respect of which the steps that a specified officer considers necessary for disposal of ashes are being carried out; and
each columbarium in respect of which the steps that a specified officer considers necessary for disposal of ashes have been carried out; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in respect of each columbarium referred to in paragraph (a)(i) or (ii), a copy of the commencement of ash disposal notice given in accordance with section 8 of this Schedule.

subsection.content: The Director must make available the information kept under subsection (1) for inspection by the general public during normal office hours free of charge.

section.name: s18
section.heading: Alternative ash disposal procedures

subsection.content: A person is treated as having carried out the prescribed ash disposal procedures in respect of a columbarium if the person has carried out, in respect of the columbarium, the procedures specified in an ash disposal plan approved by the Director in respect of the columbarium.

The Director may, on application, approve an ash disposal plan in respect of a columbarium if the Director is satisfied that the procedures specified in the plan are as effective as the prescribed ash disposal procedures in facilitating the return of the ashes interred in the columbarium, or the reinterment of those ashes, under this Schedule.

An application under subsection (2) must be made, in writing, within the 30 days referred to in section 73(2)(a) or 75(3)(b)(i) or (5)(a)(i) (as the case requires) of this Ordinance as if a reference to a commencement of ash disposal notice in that section were a reference to the application.

subsection.leadIn: On determining an application under subsection (2), the Director must notify the applicant in writing of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Director’s decision; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the application is refused—the reasons for the refusal.

subsection.leadIn: If the application is refused, the applicant must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: carry out the prescribed ash disposal procedures in accordance with section 7 of this Schedule; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for the purposes of paragraph (a), give a commencement of ash disposal notice in accordance with section 8 of this Schedule within 30 days after the date on which the Director notifies the applicant of the Director’s decision.

subsection.content: Subject to any necessary modifications, the other provisions of this Ordinance apply to a person who is treated as having carried out the prescribed ash disposal procedures under subsection (1) in the same manner as they apply to a person who has carried out the prescribed ash disposal procedures.

An appeal under section 84 of this Ordinance against a decision to refuse an application made under subsection (2) does not suspend the operation of the decision, pending the determination of the appeal, unless the Director decides otherwise.

section.name: s1
section.heading: Grace period for columbarium to continue operation without selling interment right

subsection.content: This section applies to a columbarium that was in operation immediately before the enactment date.

A person who operates, keeps, manages or in any other way has control of a columbarium to which this section applies in the grace period does not commit an offence under section 11 of this Ordinance so long as the person does not sell any interment right in respect of the columbarium in that period.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: grace period (寬限期) means the period beginning on the enactment date and ending—(a)on the expiry of 9 months beginning on the enactment date; or(b)if an application is made for a temporary suspension of liability by the expiry of those 9 months—at the time when the application is finally disposed of or withdrawn.

subsection.leadIn: If an application referred to in paragraph (b) of the definition of grace period in subsection (3) is refused, it is finally disposed of at the later of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: at the time the period within which an appeal may be lodged under section 84 of this Ordinance against the refusal expires without an appeal having been lodged;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if an appeal has been lodged within time—at the time the appeal is determined or withdrawn.
